Volume 1: Afterword

Information

Table of Contents URL: https://zetrotranslation.com/novel/kami-wa-game-ni-ueteiru/

Description

The latest work by the author of "Kimi Sen"

(Kimi to Boku no Saigo no Senjou, Aruiwa Sekai ga Hajimaru Seisen)

 . The supreme Fantasy Brain Battle of Mankind vs Gods! The supreme gods who had just too much time in their hands created the Ultimate brain game that can ever exist, "Fun Games with the Gods", Right after waking up from her long slumber, the Former Goddess, Reche, declared, "Bring the human regarded as the best player of the age in front of me!" The one nominated to her was Fei, a boy who is considered to be "the best rookie in recent years." The difficulty of this "Fun Game with the Gods" is considered so high that till date there has been no one who could completely conquer it in the complete human history. That is because the Gods are absolutely irregular, unreasonable, and sometimes even incomprehensible. But that's exactly why it's would be a complete waste if one doesn't enjoy playing the game from within their heart! Thus the tale where the the genius game boy, a former goddess, and their friends goes head-to-head in the ultimate brain battle against the supreme Gods unfolds! TL: Darkapta, Hinagiku ED: Hinagiku

Chapter 0.0 (Illustrations)





















 



 







 

Chapter 0.1 (Prologue)

Chapter Prologue : |Game Start|
 God’s Game 1 – “God Pretend”,
 The Beginning of the Game

Translated by Darkapta

Edited by Spynine01

Edited by Hinagiku

Prologue: God’s Call

Have you ever heard of a game called “Hide and Seek”?

A Game with two dictating roles. One is of a ‘child’ who hides in their favorite place while another being; a ‘demon’ who finds this child. It is a simple and easy to understand game. A game which anyone must have experienced at least once in their life.

Oh yes, right,

In this world, there are countless gods who tend to compete with humans in games such as these.

Let me give you an example–

This tale, which has been passed down from ancient times.

An amusing tale of a clumsy dragon god, who was hiding under the seas while playing hide and seek, inadvertently slept and let 3000 years pass by…

Perhaps, this story found its beginning after the awakening of the Dragon God.

 

Here in the great cold waves of the north, “Reais-Belt”

An unexplored region covered in ice, never known to have melted in the known history. There stood a rugged ice wall, as tall as a mountain, blocking the path of any crossing adventurers.

In this area, there’s an expedition team working in this snowstorm, working on making a way through the ice wall, when suddenly one of them shouted with an astonishing voice.

“It came out! But… it’s not a fossil?”

“That … even though it should be at the same time as the ice age!?”

A huge ice block is cut out from the ice wall.

It was not a fossil of a dinosaur or mammoth that they found.

“A Human… , and that too, a girl?!”

“Hurry and contact the Mysterious Court. Yes, the headquarters!”

“… What do you mean? Why are Homo Sapiens coming out from the fossils of the ice age era?!”

What came out of the Excavation was a human.

That too, a girl who has the characteristics of a teenager.

“… Is she a human being from the time of the ancient magical civilization?”

“This isn’t a joke, how is a human even able to keep their physiological properties in this temperature of ‘-46°C’?! Also, to top it off, being preserved for a staggering 3000+ years at that! Even Mammoths are fossilized when kept for this long.”

“…………Captain…… is this child still alive?”

 

The girl was beautiful.

Her vermillion hair appeared as if it was dancing like a bright burning flame, swayed by the wind.

While,

Her adorable eyes had the same look as of a modern girl and her red rude vermillion cheeks speak as if she were still alive.

The naked body still had some threads of clothing present.


Looking at her naked body; It appeared delicate, you could actually see the undulated girly curves tracing her body.

Perhaps she had originally worn clothes, but after an outstanding 3,000 years, the exposure to this extreme cold, must have tattered and frayed the fibers of her clothes.

“She’s alive, mate……or so it appears to me……”.

“Are you sane?! I repeat myself; this is the place that was hit by the waves of the ice age! Without a special suit to defend themselves with, one is bound to freeze to death within 30 seconds!”

“Uwaaaaa”

The captain and his subordinates were taken aback by the unexpected event which took place.

They witnessed as the girl with vermillion hair opened her eyes and raised her upper body vigorously.

She then proceeded to sit down cross-legged and looked closely at the five members of the evacuation team.

“…Ah c**p, I’ve done it again?!… Has it been a thousand? No… perhaps two thousand years? AW COME ON! Did I accidentally fall asleep…again?!”.

Thought waves.

A technique used by the Gods to communicate with humans. The girl seems to be using this technique to directly speak into the heads of the excavation team.

“ I can’t quite tell how many years have passed by. Nevertheless, the language system must have changed right? Anyways, you all can understand me right?”

…

“Don’t tell me!?”

“Captain…… Did that girl in front of us, just!? ――”

“Yes, yes, I’m the one who just spoke… Oh, by the way, you can talk normally. It will be automatically deciphered by the thought transfer telepathy anyways.”

She stood up as she spoke and started brushing away the snow which had accumulated on her shoulders and her hair.

Even in the snowstorm, in this frigid temperature, she’s completely unfazed, relaxed; standing without any trouble.

“Fu~ah~ I see, hiding on the seabed while playing hide and seek was a complete mistake. I thought it was a novel and wonderful idea, but never had I thought of the possibilities of the ice age to come by as I hid in there… and fell asleep…”

“You… who are you?”

The captain in his protective winter clothing went ahead and asked her with trembling legs.

“I’m Mistral, the captain of the Unexplored Area Exploration Team, belonging to the Ruin Branch of the Mysterious Court. I found you during the excavation and thus brought you out… and rescued you. What are you intending to do?”

“Me? Ahh, I’m just a ‘former’ God”.

 

As her vermillion hair fluttered in the snowstorm, the girl claimed herself to be a God.

“Well… forget all of that. Rather, let’s play!”

“…What?”

“What else? Games! Game battles with Gods! Shouldn’t there be many in this era too?”

“Kufufufu”

The girl laughs merrily and spreads her hands as if saying, ‘I can’t wait!’

“For the time being, come at me!” [TN: She’s addressing this line towards the world]

“Bring me the best person in this Era. The person who’s the best at playing games!”.

The girl claiming to be a God smiled merrily and declared this unto the whole world of the present era.

 

Chapter 1.1

Translated By Darkapta
 Edited By Hinagiku
 PF: Devxtt
 —————————————————————————–

 

1.1

Among the many cities scattered around the world continent, the city of ruin is perhaps more remote than the most remote cities in existence…

 

[Resident data verification.]

[Resident number, 68th period, 80999, section C-63.]

[Fei Theophilus, welcome back.]

 

A city surrounded by thick steel walls ~

and towards its entrance was a young man lost in reverie.

“To be looking for a missing person for as long as 6 months… I… What am I even doing?”

The black-haired boy, his resident card tucked into his pocket, looked up at the wide sky and sighed loudly.

 “Even now the girl is gone without a trace. None can find her. Not even me. If this was the case, perhaps, just devoting myself to the ‘Play of Gods’ would have been better. But it’s too late now.”

“Oh well!”

Let’s just get back on track. Thinking about the lost time won’t change a thing.

I slapped my cheeks and started walking.

The city’s public roads were wide and beautiful. The electric cars driving on them are perhaps still the latest. As I look up, I see skyscrapers glowing in soothing dull colors.

It’s the same as six months ago.

The streets of this hidden city Ruin are still full of wonders, overflowing with life in all corners.

But, despite the scenery~~

One thing especially made Fei stop in his tracks. It was a huge screen latched on the building wall. The words displayed on the huge screen were [No. of Apostles Playing]

Hundreds of spectators were engrossed in watching this ‘LIVE’ that was being broadcasted on this huge screen.

“Game battles with Gods? That too three Gods playing simultaneously?”

In those three Giant screens were broadcasted three different Gods with dozens of apostles challenging each of them.

 

[A head-to-head Brain Battle Games between Gods and Humans]

Hundreds of spectators continued watching with bated breaths, praying for their success. Fei also continued to watch them from a distance.

…

And then, it was settled.

Within the few minutes of Fei’s oncoming, the victor was decided. Almost simultaneously, as if inevitable; on all these three screens, at once.

 

“Defeat” vs. Spirit Salamander, 82 hours of attack time, all 16 Apostles eliminated.

“Defeat” vs. Nacht the Demon God: 7 hours, all 40 apostles eliminated.

“Defeat” vs. Infinity God Ouroboros: 15 seconds, 69 apostles surrendered.

 

All in the audience let out a despondent sigh.

The sigh was so loud that even the birds sitting on the tree branches flew away, startled.

“The Salamander battle was too close…”

“Yes, even the match with Nacht could have been won if we could have just kept running and dodging for another hour…”

“Yeah… But the team… that drew out Ouroboros… really bad luck…”

 

The murmurs began subsiding as the spectators gradually began to disperse.

This became the best Box office entertainment as well as the greatest challenge for the entire humankind, “The Play with Gods”

This scene is actually quite a common occurrence, especially in respect to this game.

“Why am I just standing here! Aren’t I also one of them!”

As he was about to turn back and leave reminding himself of thus~~~

“Hey! Isn’t that Fei?!”

. . .

(The people look at him)

. . .

“That’s Fei!” “I haven’t seen you around here for a while.” “Where were you?”

The spectators who had noticed Fei shouted and pointed at him at once.

“wai..wai..Wait! I am not a person who is comfortable with that much attention!”

And so, he immediately started running. . .

…But…

probably that was the worst decision.

As soon as the people around him took notice, they started rushing towards him. The size of this mass immediately increased exponentially.

Why won’t they let me be?

The answer is quite simple actually… Because he is the best new rookie in the history of humankind itself.

“AH C’MON! I JUST RETURNED A WHILE AGO GODDAMN IT!”

. . .

Shaking the masses off track, what reflected in front of his eyes was just one massive building,

The Mystic Court.

This is the first time in six months that Fei has returned to the home of the apostles. The ones qualified to challenge Gods in their games.

 

1.2

In this world…

There are many spiritual beings that humans are incapable of seeing and perhaps even, understand. In them , higher than any other, they are the so-called “Gods.”

Spirits, Demons, Angels, Dragons.

They have been called by a variety of names since ancient times, throughout cultures.

But, a question naturally arises. How are humans now able to understand and come to cognition to such spiritual beings, who were supposed to be imperceivable to the naked eye?

The answer is quite simple actually, but well, disappointing.

The extremely sovereign, unoccupied, free Gods, having too much time on their hands, took upon themselves the responsibility to make themselves great again in front of their followers.

But… in normal circumstances, confrontation with them is just impossible.

So, to make humans able to perceive themselves, they empowered some select few Humans who fulfill their accepted criteria, and make them able to know, see and perceive them.

The phenomenon, the blessing, became widely known as

Divine Curse – ‘Arise.’

These humans, granted with this Curse, gain power that can be classified as either superhuman or supernatural type based on physical or magical enhancements respectively.

This power became the qualification to challenge these gods in a (or to their) game.

 

Chapter 1.2

Translated By Darkapta
 Edited By Hinagiku
 PF: Devxtt

 

The Ruin branch of the Mystic Court; Mystic Academy.

 

The building in front of Fei is but a Huge Modern Palace with twenty floors above ground and three beneath it.

The Mystic Court became a world organization for these Apostles challenging the “God to Games”.

Since it is a base for challenging the gods, it had to be magnificent in its own way.

well, probably to keep the impressions correct.

From the first floor of such a magnificent building…

“Yo Fei, welcome back”

A female clerk in a business suit with glasses waved at Fei with one hand wandering aimlessly while the other hidden in the depths of her pockets.

[Miranda; Managing Head] Was written on her name plate.

She is the head of this office. Her long slit eyes to the impressive intellectual face indeed gave the vibes of a bureaucratic woman from just her presence.

“It’s been a little over half a year. Looks like you’ve been busy for a while on expeditions. By the way, have you lost some weight, Fei?” (Miranda) “Ah! Yes, there were a lot of things… eh… wait…what do you mean by that manager…?!” (Fei) …

“Ugh… I really thought that I would find her this time for sure.” (Fei) “Ahaha… by the way Fei-kun, the girl you found out… was she a different person after all?” (Miranda) “… Who was the one to tell you that information… Who was it again?”

Damn it… Fei sighed the second time today as the head manager Miranda chuckled looking at his reaction.

…

“… I’m looking for a girl with bright red hair.” (Fei)

“Yes, I know” (Miranda)

“It was a different person altogether! Only because that manager told me that they found a girl who matched the description, I went on to look for her.” (Fei) “You know right, it might have just been a rumor that the manager came across you know…” (Miranda) “… I’m already looking for her desperately. I’ve been looking for her for the past six months! Have some sense dammit!” (Fei) “Fei is stronger than anyone else in Games; but somehow… you just don’t have that kind of luck heh.” (Miranda) “Who was the one who told this lie?” (Fei)

“As I said, it was just a rumor” (Miranda)

Miranda shrugged her shoulders while repeating herself.

“Anyways, welcome back. Oh, you don’t need your ID for me. There isn’t any apostle more famous than you in this building anyway. Even if it’s been six months, a face pass is just enough for you~.” (Miranda) “As usual, but aren’t you a bit too easygoing?” (Fei)

“The trick is to cut the corners moderately. Well, I won’t cut corners in case of administrative affairs. . . Ah well, just come in, come in” (Miranda) They went inside the building.

The reception lobby was kind of the same as found in any typical commercial building.

A cute receptionist… the office staff silently carrying bags in and out of the building…

If there was a difference—

It would be the presence of apostles in formal attires standing everywhere in this first-floor lobby.

They were dressed in the prescribed white clothes given by the Mystic Court; and to top it off, all seemed brand new.

“Ah. These are the new rookies of this year.” (Miranda)

Miranda smiled slightly as she noticed Fei’s gaze.

“They just received the Divine Curse – Arise last year. At present, they might be looking for a team to join.” (Miranda) “How is their performance?” (Fei)

“Hmm… I have high hopes for them, but, well, there aren’t many like you.” (Miranda) “You see, it’s not an everyday occurrence to see a rookie who’s been under the curse of Arise for less than a year and winning three games in a row with it in the Play with Gods” (Miranda) “I’m still prompted by the headquarters to let you or rather force you participate you know?” (Miranda) Miranda shrugged her shoulders in a funny way, as if giving up.

“The Apostle Fei Theophilus has been absent for half a year, what on earth is he doing?”

“… I also thought it to be for at most a week you know.” (Miranda)

The information was that he was looking for someone over there. and relying on this rumor, he kept looking aimlessly for that person in that given location for half a year. Indeed, an extremely upsetting six months.

“That’s why, Head Manager, I wanted to fill in the blanks of those wasted six months right now.” (Fei) “You want to challenge ‘Play of the Gods’ right away?” (Miranda)

“That’s really like you. I really can’t understand what kind of heart you have to not shy away from an intellectual confrontation with these Gods.” (Miranda) “I’m just a Gamer you know”. (Fei)

“I know. I know. We won’t argue with you on whether it’s just a game or not, but I’m glad you’re back.” (Miranda) “So let’s get started~~.” (Fei)

“Or so I would also like to say.” (Miranda)

Miranda pointed to the central elevator.

“Actually Fei, there’s someone I would like you to see. Come up to the seventeenth floor.” (Miranda) “Who?” (Fei)

“Hehe~, it’s a surprise. You’ll see when you get there.” (Miranda)

As they got into the elevator,

Fei turned around as he looked at the wall of the elevator next to where he had been standing.

In it were several strings of words carved.

The seven promises that the gods had given to humans.

 

Chapter 1.3

Translated By: Darkapta
 Edited By: Hinagiku

 

The Seven Commandments of Play with Gods.

·         Rule 1: Humans who receive the Divine Curse: Arise from the Gods and thus, become Apostles.

·         Rule 2: These Apostles will gain the power of either a superhuman or a supernatural type. Thus, they can now challenge the Gods in the ‘Brain Battle’ Games with them.

·         Rule 3: All Games played with the respective God is to take place in the upper spiritual world, in the ‘Playground of Elements’. The Game is to be played using the power which is endowed upon these Apostles.

·         Rule 4: The power of the Divine Curse Arise can only be exercised in the ‘Playground of Elements’ of the Gods and in the Games with Gods Only unless…

·         Rule 5: Winning any of the Gods’ Games. In such a case, a portion of the power of the divine curse Arise can be used in the real world. The more you win, the more power you unlock; that can be used in the real world. But remember~

·         Rule 6: One will lose the authority to challenge the Gods after a total of three defeats against them. Thus,

·         Rule 7: Defeat the Gods 10 times to clear the challenge. Also,

·         Rule 8: Win 10 times against the gods, and you will be awarded the “Divine Glory Celebration”.

 [Play of the Gods]

 

The goal that was set for humankind is thus, “Win ten Game Battles against these Gods.” [TL note: And prove your worth xD]

 

The conqueror of this Game will be given a “reward” by the Gods themselves.

The content of this reward is yet unknown, but taking heed from several whispered rumors, Gods will grant the victor any wish of their liking. A simple, convenient yet incredible wish for any human.

However…

The truth remains. Till there is an Apostle or rather a blessed human able to conquer this game, the contents of the aforesaid “Divine Glory Celebration” will remain a mystery.

“The whole world is still waiting for that person. That one person, who will… “ (Miranda) Who will be able to challenge and win against these Gods in Games ten times.

 

The Mystic Court can be categorized primarily to have two distinct roles.

·         The first is to present and broadcast this “Games played with the Gods” as the world’s greatest form of entertainment.

and above all, the second, (primarily)

·         To provide mental support to these Apostles who challenge these Gods in such difficult games.

 

The highest number of victories ever recorded for a single human in the entire human history is not even ten, not nine but eight. The record is of one who was deemed as a Great Genius. It might not even be an exaggeration to even say him to be a hero among the entire humankind (in Games).

But even for such a hero, ten wins was just too far. He was forced to retire after losing the third game on his attempt to win the ninth one.” (Miranda)

 

…

 

“… Yeah.” (Fei)

“Although, Fei, I believe that you can conquer them all. After all, you’re the best new rookie I’ve seen in years.” (Miranda) It was true, Fei’s present record surpassed any set before.

Three wins and no losses.

He is yet to be defeated in a battle of wits against the Gods. and thus, has emerged globally as the best rookie over the years.

The whole world is expecting him to be the first human to win a complete victory in the Game Battles with Gods.

…

“Hmm? Do you have any problems?” (Miranda)

“No, not at all. It’s just that; for me, I want to finish my business as fast as possible and then have fun challenging these Gods.” (Fei) . . .

Miranda burst out in laughter.

“Bwahaha! … really you! you… really like games, don’t you? (In truth) this was supposed to be a really important topic, you know? But you’re just the type of person who never minds such intricacies anyway. HAHAHA” (Miranda) Yes.

For Fei; the score of the strongest person in the history of humankind, or having the best rookie score ever.

Nothing matters at all.

All that matters is just.

It’s fun to fight against stronger opponents in games.

It’s this pure passion which led him to his confrontation with Gods in Games.

. . .

“… Really, I think you two guys might become a good team~” (Miranda) “Eh?” (Fei)

“I told you right? I wanted you to meet someone? Actually, there’s a girl I’d like you to meet.” (Miranda) …

“A girl?” (Fei)

“It’s actually part of the procedures right~” (Miranda) Miranda turned around. Smiling coyly.

Her smile exhibited a mischievous persona with a half mixture of perhaps anticipating a sweet romantic encounter.

“Well, she kind of asked me to bring to her the best Gamer of the current era~ well, other than you, is there any?” (Miranda) “Right~? Fei-kun~?” (Miranda)

“… Asked about me? But who? ” (Fei)

Miranda replied…

It’s a God who asked for you.

 

Chapter 1.4

Translated By: Darkapta
 Edited By: Hinagiku

 

“Do you know Fei, the news where a God in the form of a human girl was recently dug out of a permanent ice wall in the north?” (Miranda) Manager Miranda looked at him saying so.

 

Fei was staring at the buttons of the elevator as it lit up when travelling to the upper respective floors of the building.

Second Floor,

Third Floor,

Fourth Floor …….

…

“Ahh! I forgot; you don’t see this kind of news; do you Fei?” (Miranda)

“Well, even if I don’t want to, I do know so little about it. It became the news talked all around the world after all.” (Fei) Gods are the inhabitants of a higher spiritual world that the humans aren’t even able to touch.

Thus, when it was found that a year ago, one one of their kind had “Incarnated” or perhaps “Descended” into the human realm.

. . .

I still remember how big of a fuss it became about a year ago.

. . .

“…… Since her discovery was really close to this branch of the mystic court, we accepted her admission to our branch.” (Miranda) “If remembered correctly, wasn’t it about a year ago, in the excavation site…” (Fei) But well, Fei did not have any information on this matter. They really missed each other by a hair’s breadth.

He went away as soon as he got a possible clue about the girl he had been searching for from one of the managers. The blood relative he had been searching desperately over the years.

“What kind of God is She?” (Fei)

 

“Now… well,,, she is… a kind of peculiar type for even a God… Perhaps a new category altogether” (Miranda) “You see, according to her, she apparently hid in the bottom of the sea while playing Hide and Seek with a human. But… well… while hiding, she kind of fell asleep (again) by mistake. To top it off, the sleep continued for about 3000 years. In the meantime, an ice age hit that area and got her covered in a thick block of ice with temperatures ranging around -40°C.” (Miranda) “The scale of this ‘By Mistake’ seems to be in a completely new dimension altogether…” (Fei) . . .

“Since she was a living witness to an ancient magical civilization, it became a big fuss when she was found, you know?“ (Miranda) “I just wished we did not take the decision of keeping her. You see, as time went on, it became impossibly troublesome for even the Mystic Court to handle her.” (Miranda) “There is a limit for us too you know!?” (Miranda)

“Moreover, she might become angry if we touch her without her consent… *sigh” (Miranda) Well,

After all,

. . .

She is a God.

. . .

If the Gods residing in the spiritual world don’t have a physical body in the first place, then they will not even have a lifespan as such also.

In addition, since they have powers which are considered to be omnipotent, they are very different from common humans.

“By the way, this God seems to have a bodily manifestation close to that of a fire and dragon God combined right~.” (Miranda) As Miranda says this, Fei sees the elevator button light up in accordance as it moves up…

Fourteenth Floor, Fifteenth Floor, Sixteenth Floor…..

as it goes further up

 

“Although… Even though she, the God, says that she is no longer one of them, she even calls herself an “Ex-God.” Although the power, the strength seems to be still present in her.” (Miranda)

“Power? As in?” (Fei)

“Well…… It might be bad to make her angry…. Since… she might… perhaps erase the entire city from the surface of this world in less than an hour. The land would remain scorched up… and that too for several days at that…” (Miranda) “Wha?!” (Fei)

……..

 

“Ah.. and by the way, this is no exaggeration so as to say. It’s her own statements copied and pasted.” (Miranda) “….. What are you all even planning to do by keeping such a dangerous God inside your four walls!?” (Fei) ……..

 

“You know Fei-kun~” (Miranda)

“I did not think it was ‘THAT’ dangerous at first; but after a year of research, we came to a conclusion. ‘Ah, she might be well beyond even ‘too dangerous’ for us to handle.’ “ (Miranda) Miranda smiled wryly.

At about the same time,

The elevator stopped climbing as it stopped with a light ding.

. . .

‘Seventeenth Floor heh.’ I guess this is where we’re supposed to go.

and thus, arrived such words:

“I’ll get straight to the point, Fei-kun. I am putting you to look after her.” (?) ……..

 

“…….Yes?” (Fei-kun)

 

Miranda walks past Fei, as his round eyes still blinking in confusion, trying to comprehend what he just heard.

“You will be the so-called ‘tutor’ for this God who is unfamiliar with this era’s human society. But, behind the scenes, I am asking you to observe her movements and report them back to me. That will be your main task for now, Fei-kun.” (Miranda) . . .

wait.

“No, no, NO!? You want me to keep an eye on God!?” (Fei)

“Be careful at what you say. She’s got really good ears, if she hears you… well, let’s just say, it might not end with just a big trouble.” (Miranda) “Even though she has got a really cute face, don’t forget, underneath she’s a mighty…”

“A MIGHTY DRAGON GOD.”

(Miranda)

 

Miranda’s shoulders trembled just thinking about her while walking.

“Also, in this case, you are the best person for this.” (Miranda) “Rather, you are the only choice we have, there can be none besides you.” (Miranda) “You know the reason ‘why’ right?” (Miranda)

“Well, I can guess the reason ‘why’…”(Fei)

Instead of nodding, Fei just sighed.

. . .

Well ‘why’ indeed, It’s because–

 

“Because …… I will not die.” (Fei)

……..

 

“Yes. God’s power is just too great. They can kill millions of humans with the similar feeling as a baby trying to destroy a block of wood; whether we want it or not. That’s why we have to take extreme precaution, ask people who do not to die. (Miranda) Thus is the main condition for being a ‘Divine Watchers’.

 

A ‘Divine Watcher’ must have the quality to not get destroyed by God’s whims; by their Divine power.

and well,

The Divine curse ‘Arise’ that resides in Fei allows him to do just that.

 

“And so, it’s decided.” (in a monotone, Miranda)

“Forced!? Wait a bit, head Manager! I did not return to take on such a dangerous role. I came here to participate and challenge these Gods to Games and—” (Fei) “And also, one more thing.” (Miranda)

 

In front of Fei’s gaze.

The head-Manager narrowed her eyes with a slight wry smile on her face.

 

“In this regard especially, we have no choice at all. She was the one who asked for you; Going as far as to even ask us to immediately call you back.” (Miranda) “…… me? Why? (Fei)

“Didn’t I just tell you~.” (Miranda)

‘Bring to me the best human player in game battles of this era’.- Well, that’s how it is.

 

Chapter 1.5

Translated By: Darkapta
 Edited By: Hinagiku

 

The Ruin branch of the Mystic Court Institution.

The 17th floor of this elliptical building

1.3

As they proceeded forward, Fei blinked again in surprise.

“Well, because she is a former God, we are letting her sleep in the special counsel’s office.”(Miranda)

. . .

“Isn’t the treatment …… a bit too different from the apostles who live in dorms?”(Fei)

“That’s not true. Well, it’s true that we don’t give you all this first-class hotel suite, but I’m sure you are given an appropriate room with similar standards. You all are the breadwinners of the Mystic Court after all.” (Miranda)

 

As we arrived in front of the door, Head Manager Miranda took out the Golden Master-Key from her pockets.

The door to the special counsel’s office slid open as she held the card-shaped key near to the door sensors.

 

umm…

“Wouldn’t she get angry that we opened her room without permission?” (Fei)

“There’s nothing she is embarrassed of presently, here in this room. …… Oh, I guess she’s out. let’s wait for her return then.” (Miranda)

Entering inside the living room which might have also served the purpose of a drawing room.

Fei involuntarily had a wry smile looking around the various playthings scattered around.

“Hehe, this God really does love to play games doesn’t she…” (Fei)

There were darts, roulette, cards, and dice.

In case of dice especially, there are a lots of variants. from the standard hexahedron to the decahedron, and even a special 100-sided dice too.

 

All of these were lying flowing in different directions from the desk some even slowly rolling even now on the floor.

……..

Hmm…

“Wasn’t there a proverb that said, ‘God doesn’t roll the dice,’ but looking at this, they roll then quite normally don’t they?.” (Fei)

Fei picks up two of those six-sided dice that had been fallen on the floor and threw them towards the center of the table saying aloud~

“Four and Six” (Fei)

 

As the two dice rolled across the table and stopped…

Miranda’s eyes rounded up in astonishment. the two dice stopped exactly at the same numerical place as declared by Fei earlier.

…

“What is it a coincidence?” (Miranda)

 

“It’s easy. It’s easy. Hold the opposite side of the die you want to roll, towards yourself. You then just have to roll it from there and shake it vertically with the force that stops at half a turn.” (Fei)

“If you want to get six, first hold it so that the three is on top, and then swing it so that it makes a half turn.” (Fei)

…..

 

“But Fei, didn’t you just threw it on the table, so… according to that, wouldn’t you able to make half a turn, or can you?” (Miranda)

“That was thirty-one and a half turns. When you count properly, you’ll see it getting the same result as half-a-turn.” (Fei)

“Two dice at once?” (Miranda)

“Even if it is three or even four dice at once, the result will be the same. Though this little trick will probably be useless against a God.” (Fei)

 

Yes, since this trick wasn’t developed to compete against a God.

The skills that Fei demonstrated were honed in games to win against fellow humans, and even more so, they were learned to defeat just a single opponent.

 

Fei still remembers~

…… that dice and even that roulette.

…… he still remembers losing to ‘you-know-who’ every single day countless times, obsessing him to practice till death because of that frustration.

To Win

. . .

Nostalgic

Fei kept staring at these scattered playthings remembering the past without anyone’s knowledge.

. . . . .

 

“Oh, it’s Miranda!” (?)

It was then that a carefree voice came from the back of the room.

When Fei turned around, he witnessed a Vermillion hair, bright as if lit with flames – it seemed as if fire itself. Really, an embodiment of fire.

“Oh my, Lady Leo Reche. Were you taking a bath?” (Miranda)

“Yes. The human body gets dirty easily. It’s better to wash them properly, right? (Reche)

 

A girl with Vermilion hair.

Her long, bright flame-like hair looked as if it’s burning; as if fire itself.

She wore light tank top clothes. Her slender arms and legs which extended beyond the premise of her clothes were incredibly captivating. Her amber eyes shone brightly as if full of curiosity and vigor, and her upturned cheeks gave a cute and lovely but also a slight ‘Ero’ feeling.

 

At that very sight of her…

Fei found himself mesmerized, staring at her continuously, fixedly, without batting an eye. So much so to even forget how to breathe.

“Hey Miranda? Is that the person over there… perhaps…? (Reche)

“Yes Lady Leo Reche. It’s the person you requested. Fei Theophilus, I’m not sure if you’ve heard of him; but, he is a super promising apostle who at a sudden won three consecutive victories against the Play of the Gods in his newcomer debut match six months ago..” (Miranda)

“From today onwards, he will be assigned as a mentor to you, Lady Leo Reche. C’mon, Fei-kun~, say Hello.” (Miranda)

……..

“Umm… Fei-kun~” (Miranda)

……..

“Fei-kun… hello?“(Miranda)

She tapped me on his shoulders and called his name over and over again.

“Oi… Fei-kun~!” (Miranda)

……..

“………… ah ……” (Fei)


Chapter 1.6

Translated By: Darkapta
 Edited By: Hinagiku

 

Fei came to his senses.

The girl, the former God called Leo Reche, looked towards Fei’s face curiously from different angles as if assessing him.

“Human? What’s wrong?” (Reche)

 

“…… Fei-kun~, even though I also understand the cuteness of Lady Leo Reche, that doesn’t allow you to fall in love with her at first sight~. This will make you disqualified as an instructor altogether~.” (Miranda)

“No, no, no. You are mistaken, head Manager!” (Fei) Being suddenly aware of the situation, Fei turned his red face sideways in a panic.

 

Yep, let’s admit that I was mesmerized.

It is also true that my sight was glued to this girl named Leo Reshe.

But …… It was definitely not love at first sight.

It’s rather the other way round.

 

It’s perhaps not the first time seeing her. Rather, seeing someone like her That is why I was continuously gawking at her.

…

It was mainly because … she looked so much alike …… like “that person”.

 

……..

 

Yes, for Fei, there has been a girl he had been continuously searching for a long time.

At present, he might not even know where she is, but her only clue was exactly this flame like Vermilion hair as present in this Goddess.

That is why he seems to have been subconsciously staring at her.

……..

“…… It’s nothing. I was just thinking.” (Fei)

“Hmm…” (Miranda)

Miranda pushes up her glasses on to the top of her nose and says. [xD the famous glasses stereotype actions]

……..

“Well, if Fei-kun is ok with that, then I will be proceeding with my leftover businesses~.” (Miranda) [TL note: yep, strike when the iron is hot xD]

“Then, Lady Leo Reche, as to your request, here is the present best player in the Game Battles of our time. Cook him, grill him, (you can) do whatever you like to him~” (Miranda) [TL note: somehow my respect for Miranda is growing in an abnormal rate. xD]

 

“I’ve been abandoned!? (Fei)

“Well then, I’ll be returning to my office to complete my tasks, ‘both of you’ can introduce yourselves to each other in the meantime. …… Fei-kun, be a good mentor, okay~~?” (Miranda)

Miranda, The head Manager leaves the room after tapping Fei on his shoulder.

[Do it well.]

……..

Of course, the meaning was not as the role of a mentor, but as the role of a watcher of this God.

. . .

 

And thus, I am now alone with God.

But is it okay to say, “both of you”, pair an Ex-Goddess with me, a human?

I myself will not dare to say such a thing though. Well, since it was the Head Manager, it might actually be not rude.

[TL: well just dump the whole blame to Miranda xD]

……..

 

“Umm, Eeettttoo~” (Fei)

. . .

“Oh, human~, well… for the time being, I welcome you here”. (Reche) With the hem of her tank top dress fluttering, and the flame-like Vermilion hair resting on the sofa, “Sit over there, I will just prepare the table in the meantime” (Reche) Well, is it because of the difference between a Human’s and a God’s cultural understanding or perhaps consciousness…

This Ex-God, in the name of preparing the table, just swiped clean all the stuff resting on top of the table out on the floor with great force.

But well, she did say she would prepare the table. What will she prepare? Is she going to perhaps, prepare some tea and sweets to welcome me?

 

Fei’s thoughts were utterly destroyed as soon as heard her next words.

“So~, this will be all of a sudden, but let’s get started.”(Reche) it was all of a sudden indeed…

“Start what?” (Fei)

“Fufu… isn’t it obvious?” (Reche)

As the two sat on the either sides of the table,

Sitting face-to-face to the opposite end of each other, her eyes twinkled. as she opened her hands wide and said the following: “A GAME BATTLE BETWEEN ME AND YOU, A GOD AND A HUMAN!”

…… As expected,

Fei could not help but chuckle witnessing the playful nature of this former Goddess. He came to understand that this Goddess seriously loves to play Games.

That said, He didn’t expect even in his wild thoughts that as soon as they would meet, he would be forced to engage in a battle with Games.

“Oh right, I should mention my name before that; Well, according to this Mystic Court, I am being called as ‘Leo Reche’” (Reche) The name ‘Leo Reche’ was a bit unfamiliar to Fei.

Is it a name which was common in the time when the Ancient Magical Civilization flourished? It doesn’t sound common in today’s world in any way.

“So, should I also call you Leo-Reche sama from now then? (Fei) “Yes, you can” (Reche)

“Understood” (Fei)

Fei had a strained smile on his face.

 

…… Damn that Miranda…

…… Even though I came back at last hoping to again challenge Gods in Game Battles, and here she trapped and pushed into some tedious mess.

The job that Fei was put into was actually – to watch the activities of this God who came down on Earth, found to have a human form.

All the details, the accepting of the job, the requesting of the job, the mentioning of the job happened so fast and bluntly that it was actually quite hard for Fei to reply ‘No’. Even more if it is now.

“Ah, but Leo Reche sama” (Fei)

“What happened?” (Reche)

“Actually, although I even love to play games, wouldn’t it be better if we start playing after knowing each other a little better?” (Fei) (Head Manager) Miranda requested me to keep an eye on this girl.

Therefore, before starting our game battle, first things first; Gather information.

Since, if one doesn’t even know the identity of whom they are about to investigate; here this former Goddess, there’s absolutely no point in monitoring them.

 

Chapter 1.7

Translated By: Darkapta
 Edited By: Hinagiku
 ————————————————————————————————-

“I’ll accept the game. but prior to engaging in that game, since I am also your instructor, wouldn’t it be for the best if I could comprehend you a bit better?.” (Fei)

The former goddess took out a bunch of cards and said the following.

“We will, we are going to introduce ourselves through this game~” (Reche)

In front of Fei, Eighty cards were put forward.

The Eighty cards had handwritten letters on them. These cards are eventually arranged in a face-to-face format on top of the table so that the contents can be read and understood before starting the game.

“Hmm?” (Fei)

“Name, age, hometown, gender, hobbies ……. (what are these for?)” (Fei)

“I made this game since I was bored, well to waste time. I call it ‘Self-Introductory Memory Flip Card Game’”. (Reche)

“…… Well, isn’t that quite a straightforward name…” (Fei)

Well, it’s probably another form of card game, based on memorizing the positions of the said cards.

“You turn over any two cards that are facing down, if they are a pair, you receive those cards. It’s a memorization game where you have to memorize the numbers and places of the faced-down cards.” (Reche)

“Ah!, I get it”. (Fei)

“When getting the numbers by which these pairs are ought to be made, the opponent would have to give their respective self-introduction. Correct?”. (Fei)

“Yes. It’s the same rule as the memorization games but a little different. For example, if I make a pair of “hometown,” you answer where you are from. But, if I don’t get a pair, you will not answer.” (Reche)

“Understood” (Fei)

“But, you will have to answer to the matched card pairs honestly. Promise?” (Reche)

“No worries, I will” (Fei)

I will not lie.

This game would be impossible without such an obvious condition. But for Fei, as a watcher, it might be the best condition he could ever ask for.

The Goddess herself said that she will not lie, so any type of introductory question is acceptable. [TL note: Oh My Goodness Gracious]

“Okay~, well, since you have seen the questions written on these cards for introduction, lets now turn them over, mix them up, put them in a row, and—” (Reche)

“Ah wait a bit–” (Fei)

“Hmm?” (Reche)

“The mixing of those cards~, I would rather request for the cards to be shuffled up. Thank you~” (Fei)

As he says, Fei gathers up the cards that have been flipped over and distributed on the table. In a way that even he won’t be able to find out, he reshuffled those cards and started to distribute it again on the table faced down.

“You laid them face up on the table to teach me the rules and the questions that are on these cards right?.” (Fei)

“Yes. But I turned it over and mixed it up. wait…… No way. ……” (Reche)

Her eyes widened up and looked towards him.

“In that span of time, I memorized all of the card arrangements. I even traced back the correct position of the cards that were to be put down on the table after mixed up by you.” (Fei) [TL note: anyone seen No game no Life?]

“It became a habit. A long time ago, a certain person trained me to these games till the extent of death itself. As a result of which, I became able to memorizing the positions of 10 sets of trump cards (approximately 540 cards) for over 7 times daily. It became my daily routine to play them seven times in succession.” (Fei)

“…………” (Leo Reche)

The former God’s mouth went agape in astonishment. [TL note: No wonders, even I would]

It seems that, even Gods have similar expressions like that of surprise as that of a human being.

Then~

The Goddess voiced aloud her delight, even all over her face,

“So~ Wonderful~” (Reche)

“You’re incredible! I like this! To see a human who is in love with Games to this very end, I just love them. Best of all, that attitude you showed, is just the Best!” (Reche)

The Dragon God, Leo Roche, understood.

The reason behind the proposal made by Fei.

Fei would never use a cheat like memorizing the cards and its place in a game battle which actually depends on the players to memorize the location and form of cards.

Fei would rather want an honest battle with these Gods. A straightforward match despite what type of match it might be.

“I like your fearless attitude towards a Goddess such as me. But well, …… then this game might be not so well suited to be played on top of such a small and narrow table right~.” (Reche)

……

“Eh?” (Fei)

“If not on a table, then, on this tatami-floor?!” (Fei)

Not long after Fei started wondering what she might decide to do; this Dragon God, this girl snapped her fingers. And~

“Now Float! Start Spinning and Randomize!”

The group of eighty cards started to float.

Those flipped cards, enveloped in a pale red glow, began to rotate above the heads of Fei and the Goddess, like a spinning roulette moving in random patterns.

Telekinetic, Psychokinesis – Both are the divine powers of Gods.

The rotating and revolving cards kept moving on air, never staying in the same place for even a second.

 

Moreover,

“Wha!?, the trajectory and speed of the aerial rotation are all unique to each other!?” (Fei)

“Oh, aren’t you quick on noticing!?. Good. Good. fufufu~” (Reche)

The girl, who used to be a Goddess, voiced her delight.

“It’s a good thing you noticed. Truth be told, even I don’t know how they will turn. But don’t you agree, it will be more fun this way~. This idea just now dawned upon me though~.” (Reche)

“Now I see. So in other words…” (Fei)

Three-Dimensional Memory Flip Card Game

 


Chapter 1.8

 

Translated By: Darkapta
 Edited By: Hinagiku

 

 

For a normal memory flip card game, once Fei knows the location of a card, he would never forget it.

Perhaps the same goes for Leo Reche too.

So, if there is an additional rule like continuously changing the arrangement of the card, it might be quite impossible for a normal person to even try to remember.

 

Such an idea dawned upon Leo Reche.

 

As the rule was enacted in accordance with this game. Every second, one or the other card crosses over the air and goes to another location.

 

“So, in addition to the placement, you now have to memorize the entire trajectory that the card takes as it changes its location hmm?.” (Fei)

“Right~ Right~. So~,”

“are you up for it?” (Reche)

 

“You bet I am~.” (Fei)

 

“Okay then~. Ah! just one last condition. I would like to add an original rule to this game. A unique one since we are at it. Just this for game only. You don’t mind, do you?” (Reche)

umm…

“…… By the way, what kind of unique rule are you planning on adding?” (Fei)

“An absolute one-turn system.”

 

As she professed

Reche took out a regular bundle of trump cards. From there, she pulled out two pieces of the same card.

[5 and 5].

In other words, she had in her hand a pair of the cards having same numbers. She showed them to Fei.

 

“There is a rule that allows a party to get another turn when they are able to bring out the same card in this game right?” (Reche)

“Well, …… it’s probably one of the mainstream rules.” (Fei)

“Well, That will now be a no for this game then~.” (Reche) Even if you hit a pair or miss a pair, you will only get a single turn.

Just that.

 

It was actually quite surprising for a God, even if a former one to add or even want to add a new rule, an ‘original one’ at that to an existing game.

Well, it might not make much of a difference in any case for Fei though. But-OH MAN… NOW THAT MIGHT ACTUALLY BE NOT THAT GOOD!!!

contrastingly, Fei’s inner heart was in fact screaming at the top of its voice on hearing this rule.

As he calmed, and contemplated on what he understood~,

…… I see.

…… Actually, in regard to this game, this additional rule might actually be pretty troublesome to handle!

 

……

 

Fei’s heart started racing. The tension, the elation, the fear – a feeling that he had forgotten long ago – gradually starts returning back to him.

He could not help it. He was unable to contain that excitement as his body temperature too gradually start to rise.

 

“Is that okay with you?” (Reche)

“Bring it on!” (Fei)

 

To that smiling girl, Fei responded with a bold affirmation.

 

Now Fei understood, This in no longer a Memory Flip card game, it is no longer what the name describes it to be.

From the moment the “absolute one turn system” was added, the game transformed into a completely different type altogether.

 

…… This is no longer a memorization game.

…… This has now become a game of information exchange and sorting where you are asked to make a choice at each turn.

 

These Eighty cards.

Now, none of them are equivalent to the other.

 

The Dragon Goddess, Leo Reche clapped her hands in excitement.

and said ~

 

“All right~. Then Let’s Get Started~.”

 

“You can have the first turn” (Reche)

“so then, after you ~” (Reche)

 

In response to the gesture of the former God Leo Reche, Fei pointed to the two pieces above her head.

“Ah~ then without further ado. I will be choosing those cards then ~” (Fei) The two cards chosen by Fei flipped on mid-air. But fortunately, or unfortunately, these two were not the same pair of ‘Self-Introductory’ cards.

 

The first turn of any card flipping game is completely based on luck.

The probability of getting a correct pair on the first turn is not even two percent. Its even said that the chance of getting the correct card in the first turn – in real life is comparable to zero.

 

To say what those cards were ~

“Name and Blood Type eh ~.” (Fei)

“By the way… Do Gods even have a blood type in the first place?…” (Fei) “Its hotter than Lava ~” (Reche)

“yes?”

 

you see…

“I’m an incarnation of fire and blood God manifested in the form of a dragon. That’s why~, if even by mistake a small speck of my blood drops, this building will melt like a pulp.” (Reche) “…… there is even a limit to ‘worst case scenario’ damn it” (Fei)

Well,

“If you want to learn more about it, just flip about the pair mentioning the blood-type ~” (Reche) While twirling her hair with her fingers, the former God named Leo Reche giggled delicately, answering Fei regarding the asked question.

 

“So ~ the next is mine right?, now then… what shall I pick~” (Reche)

The girl who is speaking happens to sit in a seiza on top of the tatami mat; perhaps so, while bending forward to have a look into the cards rotating and traversing in front of her.

Even though she is looking at them with a serious look.

 

“That…position…. is a bit… ummm” (Fei)

“Hmm? What’s wrong?” (Reche)

“Well, umm, there is no problem with the rules; nope probably there is none… but…” (Fei)

His whole conscience is trying its best to look away.

 

After all, the collar band of this tank-type top is loose in proportion to her figure, so… whenever she bends forward like that, Fei is able to have a glance into the cleavage between her b*****s.

 

…… That too quite awfully.

 

Moreover,

The chest was not the only problem over there….

Chapter 1.9

Translated By: Darkapta

 

Moreover,

The chest was not the only problem over there….

……

“Maybe Gods doesn’t have a concept of underwear. ……?” (Fei)

……

“Oh, underwear neh ~. Even though I took the form with the same flesh as that of a human, I still am unable to understand this concept of underwear.” (Reche)

“I mean; There are already clothes to cover our skin, so why is there even a need to put another batch underneath? (Reche)

“…… No… umm… Well, that’s…” (Fei)

quite hard to answer… or so Fei wanted to say…

But,

Yes,

This girl: Leo Reche; this former God is clearly not wearing anything underneath her b*****s at the present moment.

And so, from the gaps of her clothes, all seems to be visible.

Also…

Since she is in a human form at present, the bulge protruding out emphasizes on her womanly qualities all the more verily.

making Fei…

“…… I… can’t concentrate”. (Fei)

 

……

“Oh, that’s no good. It’s not good at all if you can’t concentrate on the game.” (Reche)

Leo Reche jumped onto the sofa because Fei was having difficulties.
 In that momentum, she pointed towards the two cards which were on the mid-air.

“This and this! Arghhh~ . It’s “from” and “age”, uuu… Your turn then.” (Reche)

“Hmm… so then I will be taking these two. Oh, (Yes~), the ‘Origin’ pair is made”. (Fei)

Fei was the one, who was able to construct the first pair in the game.

And with this, now, Leo Reche will have to introduce her ‘Origin’ to Fei.

“Well, well… You see, it’s probably the same for most gods. But well, My origin, just like any other God, can be traced back from the ‘Elements’ or the region called the ‘Playground of the Gods’. This is the same space that humans refer to as the ‘higher spiritual world’. Did you know that humans need to go through a special door to enter?

“Yes. since, even I was using one until six months ago.”

Humans are not capable to enter the spiritual upper realms where Gods live.

Therefore, in order to participate in the Game Battles with Gods in this ‘Playground of Gods’, it was necessary for the humans to cross a ‘special door’.

It is a knowledge quite familiar to Fei. Since he is an Apostle.

 

Thus, perhaps quite worthless.

 

But,

Rather, his motif was on another thing~

By this obedient and correct response by the Dragon God Leo Reche, Fei understood at least one thing for sure, perhaps also the most important thing for him, as a watcher. The ‘Harvest’ that Fei was looking for. [TL note: Truthfulness]

“You answered everything without holding back. Really, I am a bit surprised.” (Fei)

“Isn’t it obvious? It’s the rule of the game (humph~). Rules are not just commitments.” (Reche)

“Something to have fun with?” (Fei)

“Exactly! Great answer, that’s how it is~” (Reche)

The girl who was once a former God happily looked at him closing one of her eyes.

 

The act was so cute, charming and adorable that it made Fei’s face unconsciously develop a sweet red blush on his cheeks.

 

And so, the game continues~

 

Slowly one after another, the cards are flipped

Getting itself revealed.

As moments pass by, the number of cards to be remembered gradually increases.

 

“So~ this, now, is… ‘Economic Power’ and ‘Hobby’… arghh!!! — again a miss.” (Reche)

…

“Come to think of it, wasn’t there a hobby card flipped a while ago? Do you remember?” (Reche)

The pair of “Hobbies” is the second from the back of the four cards flying directly behind me, and the third from the right of the six cards circling the window. (Fei)

As Fei declared, the two cards whose positions were called, turned over, and the ‘hobby’ pair was now formed.

“Wow, you’re good~! (Reche)

The Dragon girl, Leo Reche clapped her hands ecstatically.

Even though her opponent took the opportunity and matched up those paired cards, she acts as if she was the one who was victorious.

Without an inch of regret; rather, in contrast, while praising him with a huge smile on her face she said:

“I was waiting for someone like you for soo long!” (Reche)

 

and then,

She proceeds to tell ~

“My hobby is, as you have correctly guessed; GAMING!” (Reche)

“――――” (Fei)

……

“Even so its me, when there is absolutely no reaction, even I would also feel a bit… lonely” (Reche)

“… No no no… actually, I just thought that… there would be so… well… I was thinking if there was anything or something other than that…” (Fei)

In front of that sweet, adorable girl, Fei could just sit and smile bitterly.

 

I failed.

The truth actually is, Fei had some expectations in his mind. If this former God had any other hobbies than gaming, there would have been some information that could have been obtained on the process.

During these chain of events.

As a God’s watcher, Fei would had loved to get such a valuable information.

 

However, so it seems… this God is just, all about games.

–But. well ~ on a different note…

If the Head manager, Miranda had seen this game and how they were playing, she would have definitely been astonished.

Since…

Even though there were dozens of cards circling and traversing in mid-air all this time, the two of them only looked towards each other; chatting and laughing.

They must have memorized all the orbit and orbital speeds of each and every card traversing in mid-air.

They might be constantly calculating in their brains. Where a particular card is; Where now its circulating, traversing behind their backs.

 

“Hey ~, I’ve got the ‘name’ card together. So, what is your name?” (Reche)

 

“Ahh, right. I am yet to introduced myself, eh? …… I am Fei Theophilus. As you can see, the person dragged by Ms. Miranda and pushed to accept the job.” (Fei)

“And your nickname?” (Reche)

“I’ve never been called anything other than Fei.” (Fei)

“But well, … I see. In names, nicknames are also possible.” (Fei)

 

This is one of the typical application of this self-introductory game.

From the paired cards, one is allowed to continuously ask whatever question which is connected to that card. One can actually expand the range of questions about to any extent till that is related to the card.

 

“Okay~, so then, It’s now my turn, I’ve got this ‘gender’ one made now” (Fei)

“Wha?! Eh!? You are really asking such a cute girl about her gender *gusun? After all this time?!” (Reche)

“…… What’s with that cliché response…” (Fei)

“That’s what it was written in one of those human’s book ~” (Reche)

“There ~ see  behind you ” (Reche)

Saying that, Leo Reche pointed towards the book lying on the back of the sofa.

Chapter 1.10

Translated By: Darkapta

 

“There  see  behind you ~” (Reche)

Saying that, Leo Reshe pointed towards the book lying on the back of the sofa.

…

On the floor were like hundreds of books spread out, some even on top of each other: gossip magazines, newspapers, comic books, novels, history books, scientific research papers and such …

“That’s all from last week.” (Reche)

“I’ll be getting again, the same amount this week too.” (Reche) “I want to learn more and more about humans.” (Reche) but the better question was probably…

“…… that much… and just in one week…” (Fei)

As he was in his trance over the sheer amount of books lying around. He suddenly realized…

 

It was only about six months ago that she awoke from her ice-tomb. To top that, she is having a normal conversation with Fei in his own language… on top of that, naturally… This was something quite abnormal, even astonishing to begin with.

…… Did she even master reading and writing? All in less than a year?

…… As expected … their ability to learn new things is something extraordinary … they are indeed not to be reckoned with…

well, It might be said that, she is trying to understand humans to sate her greed.

But, on an opposite angle, it’s all just a straightforward effort to play games with humans.

“So, have you actually learned everything from grammar to vocalization of our modern languages? That’s amazing! ……” (Fei) “I mastered it all in just a week {degozaru yo~}” (Reche) “No NO No…Its not at all mastered! I just now heard something weird mixed at the ending of your sentence…!” (Fei) “Well, well, isn’t it fine~” (Reche)

Also,

“Well, I had no gender in the first place. When I took the form of a human, it was this figure to begin with. So, to answer your question now, I would say myself to be a ‘girl’ … will it be ok?” (Reche) “Hmm… now that you tell, that is quite true” (Fei)

The moment the Dragon God took the form of a human named Leo Reche, it naturally took the same biological configuration of that human it transformed into. That is, of this girl.

“Ah! I should probably show you the body inside these clothes. It is the same body as that of a human girl”. (Reche) “DON’T SHOW!!!” (Fei)

Fei hurriedly stopped this airhead girl’s hand which was about its way undressing the upper half of her clothes.

“WHAT THE HECK ARE YOU DOING ALL OF A SUDDEN!?” (Fei) “Eh?! But I was just justifying you my gender … isn’t it necessary according to the rules?” (Reche)

“EVEN SO!”

“Ahhh damnit!… Why am I the one sweating more over here…” (Fei) “You don’t like me taking off my tank-type top right? Then how about these long pants?” (Reche) “ITS EVEN WORSE… I KNOW YOU ARE DEFINITELY NOT EVEN WEARING YOUR UNDERPANTS AT THE MOMENT!” (Fei) “Have some shame about that area. You’re a Goddess!”. (Fei) Ahhhh I absolutely don’t feel like I am competing with a God now. Its rather feels as if I am playing with a pure and innocent child who is head over heels for games.

But…

That impression of Fei was about to get completely obliterated in the next few moments.

 

Okay ~

“So ~ next is my turn” (Reche)

Brushing away her crimson like fiery hair sideways, Leo Reche pointed to a certain card which was dancing above the ground: “That one!” (Reche)

The first card she turned over was a white card.

And as the second one also turned and happened to be the same, a pure white card.

…

Fei gasped.

“Ah!” (Fei)

I’ve been had.

The card Leo Reche happened to upturn. It was the same card which even Fei was aiming for.

This cannot be a coincidence.

A wildcard.

A card which happens to be similar to the Joker in the Game of Trump(s).

The person who gets this card, that is, a card which does not contain any form of self-introductions type written on it, a pure white card. That person, by the rule of the card, is allowed to ask any type of question whatsoever; Any and that too

Freely.

“Hehe, I’ve always wanted to get one of these ~.” (Reche) She happily showed Fei those pair of wild cards she won.

 

“Now ~, what shall I ask you?” (Reche)

“Ah right ~, human, you do remember our first agreement, right?” (Reche) “…… Well …yes.” (Fei)

To Answer all questions asked till the best of one’s knowledge.

 

A promise made before starting the game. An agreement made to make this game more acceptable.

An assurance which was taken before starting the game.

An assurance which prohibits either of the player to tell a lie.

“So, my question to you, human, will be: ~”

“To meet what purpose did you approach me, Human.”

 

……

Shudder.

A feeling like being stabbed across the spine with an icy cold knife.

The same feeling now was being felt by Fei.

Was it hallucination?

She is right in front of him.

But…

As she began speaking those words, almost instantly, the whole atmosphere around her became fiery hot.

The innocent eyes that she used to turn towards him until a while ago was now replaced by the eyes of the Dragon.

The eyes of a being that transcends humanity.

What emerged now was no longer the eyes of a human girl’s. It was the eyes of her true being. A prying gaze.

A Dragon’s prying gaze.

The girl with crimson haired continued…

“Answer me, human. I will not tolerate any falsehood towards my questions.”

 

From her voice alone, a voice so tremendous that, any normal human could hallucinate themselves turning into speck of dust. That too probably in an instant.

Do-ku – Do-ku. Do-ku – Do-ku

Fei was no exception. Even though he possessed the spell Arise of immortality, he was unable to stop his heart from palpitating.

If it were anyone other than himself, (s)he would have definitely collapsed right at that very spot, being unable to breathe.

 

Yes…

This was the reason why the Mystic Court judged this very being to be someone who is “uncontrollable”.

…… What do you mean by ‘A former Goddess?! . Took a form of a human being?!

…… What I am witnessing before me is Absolutely A Goddess In Entirety!!

Fei had already defeated three Gods before in the “Play of the Gods” in the a Game of wits.

But even for Fei, who had defeated those three Gods successantly, this was the first time he felt intimidated.

…… From the very beginning, her and my aim were the same.

…… The aim of us both, while playing, enjoying and joking with ourselves. Both of our aim was actually just one. To get our hands on ‘that’ wild card…

Fei remembered all the pairs of cards that were once upturned. Their respective places too.

But

Of course, she would probably remember too.

Among them, the one to draw out the wildcard first was purely a showdown of luck.

[TL note: since both had yet to upturn any wild card, can be a probable argument for this sentence.]

That was exactly why ~

“Hahaha, both of us are cut from the same cloth huh! Hahahaha” (Fei) Fei couldn’t help but burst out laughing.

Chapter 1.11

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

That was exactly why ~

“Hahaha, both of us are cut from the same cloth huh! Hahahaha” (Fei) Fei couldn’t help but burst out laughing.

 

“I’ve been trying to get that wild card for a while now, to think even you were aiming for that ~ ahahaha.” (Fei)

“Hue?” (Reche)

The Dragon Goddess was in astonishment.

 

…

How can this human even continue to laugh after witnessing the prying eyes? These eyes of divinity?

 

“Oh well, it seems that the aim of head manager Miranda was all to visible in the first place to the eyes of a God ~.” (Fei) “Well, due to that, I was able to enjoy an interesting game. So I will not complain ~” (Fei)

The question asked from this God questioned about the real purpose behind Fei approaching her.

 

If Fei was asked frankly and directly, Fei could had just replied with, “I was told to be your mentor.”

However, the moment it was asked in this game, a game where the rules bound him to say the complete truth were accepted, the circumstances became a lot more different.

 

“Then let me answer your question. …… About my purpose heh… well to be very frank, it is to observe you.” (Fei) “A God from the spiritual upper world suddenly descending upon the Earth. That in itself is a phenomenon yet to be understood by humans.” (Fei) “Thus, I was told to absolutely make sure of what your true intentions were, and your nature.” (Fei)

…

“――――” (Fei & Reche)

 

Will my whole body now be torn apart?

The words he spoke can easily incur the Wrath of Gods. Knowing that in mind, Fei still unravelled those true motifs in front of her.

 

It’s no wonder that this girl, this Dragon God doesn’t comprehend that. [TL note: This is what Fei thinks perhaps]

Because if she could comprehend that, she would just look at him constantly without batting an eye, nor even moving a finger.

 

“Also …the way the Mystic Court treated you, you might understand by now; they, the Mystic Court meant you no harm. I hope you understand that they were only concerned about humanity as a whole. Since they are one of those organizations which shoulders the fate and weight of human race” (Fei)

“…………” (Reche & Fei)

 

Brushing off her fiery crimson-like hair, Leo Reche said

 

“Well, I asked you because I more or less had the feeling about that being the case ~.” (Reche) The girl in front of Fei rather smiled happily.

 

“All right ~, thank you ~. You answered me honestly. You also accompanied me and took this game seriously. I am now absolutely sure. You are a good human.’ (Reche)

“Even if you say that so suddenly like that…” (Fei)

 

“I said it from start right ~, that I personally like you. Else, I wouldn’t had asked you such a question. It’s not even a question you can just ask to anyone in the first place, but only to those you can trust.” (Reche) The dragon’s eye which just until recently gazed him, softly and verily disappeared. It was as if it were melting ‘back’ into the sun.

What remained in place was the previously innocent girl.

The girl named LeoReche, who was smiling, softly.

 

However,

It was not the disappearing of those eyes which surprised Fei.

Rather,

Witnessing a sudden change of her approach towards him, made Fei, skip a beat.

 

[TL Note: since it was impossible to tell this change of addressing, I thought of skipping it. Actually, Earlier, LeoReche addressed him as “Omaye” (お前) but after this exchange, this changed to “Kimi” (キミ). Well, why did she do it and why did Fei skip a beat is all to your imaginations XP .]

 

“I will call you Fei from now . Ah right! that’s why, you should also call me as Reche . Also, Being respectful, or polite speech is is a no go. Playing games without worrying the sense of distance makes it all the more fun ~.” (Reche)

“…… Somehow … the distance closed almost instantly. …will it be really okay to be so friendly with me?” (Fei)

“Yes of course! You have lived up to the expectations of this game.” (Reche) As she says, she throws away the pair of wild cards from her hands.

On the other hand, she went and picked up the pair of cards that was arranged in Fei’s side of the table.

 

“The cards you were aiming for were ‘gender’, ‘origin’, and ‘hobbies’. From the very start, you weren’t thinking of winning right ~” (Reche) [TL note: winning by the number of cards]

 

Yes…

 

“…… Precisely so ~.” (Fei)

 

Fei’s main objective was not to win by having the greater number of cards in the first place.

He understood the silent truth behind this re-developed game.

 

‘Even if one knows the location of a pair card. Once should not draw it out. Till it meets their objective’

 

This was because, this game was no longer the same memorization game where you had to memorize the pairs and grab it when your turn comes.

 

The moment from when the added rule was implemented. It denied a second opportunity which comes after successfully pointing out the correct pair of cards.

This in itself completely changed the essence of the game which previously followed.

 

It was now about what to choose, and what to forsake.

 

For example ~, For the said card : ~ ‘Name’.

This was one of those cards which should never be taken by Fei. For him, it’s useless since he already knows her name in the first place.

Since the game did not run by its previous rules. Using a turn to take this card would only mean the wasting of a turn for him.

 

…… All because of the addition of that “one turn absolute system” rule into the game.

…… The rule which disregarded the previous common knowledge of collecting the greater number of cards can lead one to victory; After the rule’s addition, that type of common theory became completely useless.

 

It was now necessary to assess whether it’s worth consuming one of your turns and take up that respective pair of cards.

 

The game now became an information sorting game in which you are forced to judge every turn, weighing every card you remember and according to the information decide whether you want the said card in the first place.

A game where you have to sort out between which information you seek, and which to leave.

 

As soon as Fei understood this. He only had his eyes on the cards which had the information he seeks, the information he wants in the first place.

 

So much so as to forsake the thought of winning the game by collecting the greater number of cards.

 

“…… Ah, right! I wanted to ask you something ~” (Reche)

“Weren’t you also aiming for that wild card ~” (Reche)

“What was the question you were planning to ask me?” (Reche)

“Will you answer that question……?” (Fei)

“Ahh, since you are telling to not use my polite manner with you, I will speak normally.” (Fei) But.

“I will speak the reason for why I was aiming that card but, only if you answer to the reason, the question that you are asking me to tell.” (Fei) “I will answer, but well, only depending upon the question you would have asked.”

 

and so Fei asked

“Why me?”

 

Chapter 1.12

Translated By: Darkapta

 

“Why me?”

 

“Why did you decided to choose me when there are so many higher ranked Apostles to choose from?” (Fei)

Fei’s rank was III.

This means that he has won three games in the Play of Gods,

but…

there are many others in this branch of the Mystic Court who have higher ranks than Fei.

Moreover…

“Especially if you go to the headquarters of the Mystic Court—” (Fei)

“Yes, but you are the only new rookie who has won three games in a row, without a loss.” (Reche)

In this world, it is said that more than a thousand people undergo this divine awakening, ‘Arise’ every year after being selected by the divine. So, in other words, the number of apostles will increase each year by that amount.

However, there was yet to be someone who can surpass Fei’s “three consecutive victories” over God.

“Even if you go back over the past hundred years, it is still debatable whether there are even rookies who fit the bill.” (Reche)

But…

“Even though I aspired to join… the team with who I was supposed to be paired with sidelined from the Games altogether and went somewhere else in these six months…” (Fei)

“Even the Head Manager Miranda was troubled you know?” (Fei)

But…

………

“Nope… that was rather… because of the wrong information propagated by the head of the office …” (Fei)

“THAT’S WHY” (Reche)

Leo Reche pushed away the trumps which were in the way as she brought her face in front of Fei.

“You said you want to know more about me right? Then it would be the best to cooperate with each other.” (Reche)

“Actually, I want to conquer this ‘Play of the Gods’ with you (ne) ~.” (Reche)

“…… ‘Play of the Gods’? (Fei)

The Dragon God Reshe is said to be one of the pillars among gods who control this ‘Play of the Gods’.

In a general sense, she can be understood as the final creator, the boss of a game.

On another sense, a unique boss, who is to be defeated. While again being the princess or the heroine who gives rewards for defeating this unique boss.

However,

she is not among the challengers.

It can only be the Human side who is allowed to challenge a God.

But…

As she plays with the tips of her vermillion hair around her finger, she continues to speak…

“You know… I was so excited to play with humans that I came down upon the mortal realm leaving the spiritual upper realms and took this flesh body . But… later I understood that going from a spiritual realm to this physical realm was actually a one-side trip.” () Reche

Saying so… she gave out an awkward embarrassed smile.

“hehe… as a result, I became unable to return being God by mistake.” (Reche) [Tl: tehe pero X3]

“…… THeRe is A LiMit To CARELESSNESS DAMNIT !…” (Fei)

 

“No problem… No problem… I just need to challenge in the Game of Gods ~” (Reche)

“Why so?” (Fei)

“I just have to win 10 games against Gods. If I do so, I will be again return being a God.” (Reche)

 

The Seven rules of playing with the gods.

Rule 7: If anyone wins 10 games against Gods, that person will be the conqueror of this game. That person would have cleared this game.

Those who conquered this game will be awarded the Glory of God ‘Celebration’.

 

Now, no one actually knows what this “reward” actually is…

 

although …….

 

If you’re a former god, then the story is a bit different.

“…… Perhaps… Reche knows the truth about the Glory of God ‘Celebration’?”

Fei asked

“Of course.” (Reche)

“Well, what you humans envisioned it to be is more or less right. That, God will grant that person one wish of their choice. Till that point, yep they are indeed not wrong.” (Reche)

“Is it really just that?. …… But, as you say, if it’s not wrong, doesn’t that also mean, that’s not right as well?”

Well its kind of like

“The wishes are not limited to one. A hundred, a thousand, as much as you like” (Reche) [TL: xD]

“ARE YOU GODS OUT OF YOUR MIND!?… JUST HOW MUCH GENEROUS ARE YOU TRYING SHOW YOURSELF TO BE!?” (Fei)

“But even one is yet to achieve that.” (Reche)

“……. Well… yes, …I see.” (Fei)

The logical answer given back by Reche made me calm down instantly.

Yes, if one is able to succeed this impossible feat, (getting 10 wins according to the rules,) it is only correct to get all their ambitions fulfilled. It can be told as an equivalent exchange.

Since, the task is so hard, even a person is yet to succeed.
 It’s like, according to the divine scales, both sides are equally placed; Balanced.

“That is why… I want to be paired with you. Rather, I want to play alongside with you.” (Reche)

“You mean, create a team with us two?” (Fei)

“ …Won’t?” (Reche)

“Nope… Rather, I am honored.” (Fei)

The ‘Play of the God’ is a head-to-head brain battle between Gods and humans, where the Gods decide the context of the battle.

Simply said, God v/s Human battle.

But… for Fei, team is something he is still not yet that much comfortable about

…… Truth be told, I was still a bit reluctant in choosing a team.

……. Since, the team where I was earlier, disbanded; that too within six months after I joined.

But to participate in the game, I have no choice but to wander around trying to get into a team, rather getting a team willing to take me.

But, in this time, where I was pondering about which team to join, to my surprise, I am getting an invitation.

 

Without realizing, Fei was clenching his fists tightly.

“I would love to join you.”

Games are meant to have fun with.

It was a belief that Fei had held dear to ever since he had been taught by “That Person” in childhood.

 

Moreover, teaming up with the girl who was once a God.

Such a heart-exciting experience is not even something you can even if you wish for it.

 

“I get to watch a Former God-sama play closer than anyone else. Just thinking about it makes me extremely excited.”

“…… ehehehe.” (Reche)

The girl, the former God giggled with a cute smile.

“I like this about you. I knew it, after all, you are the same kind of person I though about. Then its decid—-” (Reche)

“Ahh but!” (Fei)

The two quick words overruled the sentence which Reche was about to finish.

“We just met. Also, even though I have some experience of being in a team, teaming up with a former God is also first for me. I want to be prepared properly.” (Fei)

If it’s a former God, then I know, there would be no complaints over her skills.

But if one has to think about the concerns, the first would definitely be, whether we could understand… listen to each other or not.

Since Reche was formerly a God, the way she thinks, her ideas her judgement. All would be very different from a human being.

“Teamwork; coordination among the players is very important you know. Like, when playing doubles in Tennis or even Table Tennis; being on the same page, having similar ideas, being in the same breath… listening to your team member… is really important.” (Fei)

Chapter 1.13

Translated By: Darkapta

 

“Teamwork; coordination among the players is very important you know. Like, when playing doubles in Tennis or even Table Tennis; being on the same page, having similar ideas, being in the same breath… listening to your team member… is really important.” (Fei) “Also, I have challenged The Play of Gods only three times though—” (Fei) “Didn’t you win all of them?” (Reche)

“Each and every one of them was like a hair breadth to a loss.” (Fei) “Even now I think that it was for my luck that I was able to come out victorious.” (Fei) “… If even the score would had been 0 wins 3 losses instead of 3 wins and 0 losses, that would not had been a surprise.” (Fei)

What is a Game?

To use up your wits and create the best strategy in order to win.

There are a mind game like those having bargaining. There are also games based on reading and leading. In those, finding the best solution, going through continuous trials and errors. Finally, praying and hoping for that last bit of luck, all in turn allowing to grasp the victory. That is what it means to be a game.

And amongst that,

The ‘Play of Gods’ can be undeniably called as its ultimate form.

 

“I want to challenge them even more seriously you know. Not going with just any impromptu team.” (Fei) …………

 

“… like…, take for example -= a man and a woman who just met on the streets, would they go on to Marry right afterwards?” (Fei) NO

“First, they become friends… then they come closer to each other and develop a sweet relationship, more than being friends, from there… I guess this all is going all over your head eh…” (Fei) “Nope, its ok, I can understand” (Reche)

“Ah! then its all good. So, First we need to spend some time to understand each other properly. We should take some time and build a rapport and—-.” (Fei) [TL note: Rapport come closely to being attuned]

“Go to challenge the Play of Gods immediately ne ~” (Reche) ……
