And with that, Fei looks over to the place where, a God, a Former God, the girl with fiery flame-like hair stood with her hairs fluttering.

“Your Terminal-Spirit is an excellent employee ne~. I never thought it’s rule expiations could become a hint to find out the true nature of this game.” (Reche)

“This~ :- ‘The field is made to have four corners’ “ (Reche)

The structure of the city was another hint too.

The steel pillars being lined up vertically and horizontally at equal intervals.

Just as similar to the square field of a game board. A huge game board.

That was why the God Titan chose this city especially.

Thus, congregating my words, the end of this game, Reversi is by filling up the whole board by pieces, with not a single place remaining to put pieces.

Coming to the conclusion, ‘we cannot play anymore than this’.

Thus, in terms of God-Pretend… when the whole city buildings destroyed, ‘we cannot play anymore than this’.

“Thus, bringing us to the completion of this game. Game Over. Then, the last thing would be counting of the pieces, Black or White, with which the results would be declared, right?.” (Fei)

“……Haa~n ……Haaaaa~… Mo~ Fei you really… you really… ARE OVERUSING YOUR SENIORS!” (?)

Was Asta being out of breath due to over-running, revolting against the ways of Fei.

But…

Even if she were included, White has only 3 pieces. When compared to Black’s (Titan’s) 16 pieces, they are far outnumbered. It was a desperate attempt.

Until just before the game ended.
 —–

But——-

“There is a way we could win. The one ray of light that could turn around the game completely. Since, it’s Reversi, a chain reaction follows.” (Fei)

The white which puts forth its piece in black’s den instantly makes a lot of black turn back to white.

A common knowledge which allows a huge comeback in the game of Reversi possible.

And regarding this God-Pretend too, this very rule was also present.

Though very cleverly hidden.

“Eh…… EHHHHHH~……!” (Apostles)

“Why are we?! Why are we reverted to being untouched!?” (Apostles)

 

Just like when Asta, and then Vice-Captain got converted by God Titan.

The verdict came that even the two apostles near the Vice-Captain were also caught by God, as if it were a curse, passed onto them.

At that time, it seemed to them that the rule states that nearby apostles, or contacted apostles also get judged as contacted.

But, through Reversi, this can be easily explained.

“At that time didn’t Asta use a spell of wind which caused those three apostles, the Vice-Captain and his three associate apostles slam to the outer wall of the buildings?” (Reche)

“That was most probably not to restrain their movements. But to put them in a single line in between Asta and God..” (Reche)

Yes,

And it was just by chance, in front of that building.

Just imagine, a board where the pieces are arranged in such a way…

Black (Titan), White, White, White, Black (Asta). The arrangement of pieces with respect to the board, when Vice-Captain and the two apostles were caught.

Thus, even the aide-apostles of the Vice-Captain, who were caught in the string of events, got turned over to the God’s side with the vice-captain.

“I used the exact same tactic in the sidelines, using Fei to attract the attention of the God Titan.” (Reche)

Pon~

Reche puts her hand on top of Asta’s shoulders.

“At that time, the reason I jumped out of that department building was actually to head towards the building where this human was hiding.” (Reche)

“Let’s split up. It would be okay right, to split up the apostles’ downstairs equally towards each each other?” (Reche)

“Yep, exactly a half towards each other.” (Fei)

The number of apostles chasing Reche, were seven.

They did not even know… That Reche was not actually running away. But running towards Asta, to join her, who was in hiding.

For a perfect surprise hit.

Towards the seven apostles who were chasing Reche, Asta activates her wind spell. Thus, causing them to slam towards the outer walls of the building, Forcing them to line up in a row.

(In the same standing position, as before,)

White (Asta), Black Black, Black Black, Black Black, Black, White (Reche).

Then all you have to do is touch one black piece.

And thus, the seven peoples sandwiched in between Asta and Reche. All converted back to white in a chain reaction.

“Thus I, believing in them, trusting them, did my best to contain you, God, over here.” (Fei)

Thus, now white were 9 in number: (Reche and the Eight apostles including Asta).

And at the very end, Fei returning back to white through self-revival decided the victory in favour of the white.

Thus,

White 10: (Reche and Nine apostles including Fei and Asta).

Whereas,

Black 9: (God Titan and Eight apostles).

“Thus, our victory. Any arguments?”

………… None…

A clumsy declaration of defeat by a God who should not speak any human language. A defeat declaration, given only to Fei alone, secretly.

As Fei fell from the sky toward the ground, he was received in the palm of the Divine Titan who then slowly lowered him next to Reche.

 

And when Fei turned around…

The figure of the Giant God Titan was nowhere to be found, nowhere in the ‘Playground of Gods’.

Ahhh, I have played my fill.

I am completely satisfied,

As if it were saying.

 

VS

“The Wise God of the Earth”

“Titan.”

 

A Game Battle with God.

The game was won by Apostles/Humans in 3 hours and 31 minutes.

 

Victory condition:

At the end of the game, the number of white players exceeds the number of black players.

 

Defeat Condition 1:

All the players must be caught (because there will be no white player to overturn the black pieces).

Defeat Condition 2:

The Black player, God, has more pieces than the White player at the end of the game.

 

Hidden Rule 1:

Those who become incapacitated by God’s attack will be converted to its side.

Hidden Rule 2:

You can return to the human side by contacting Titan’s subordinates just as in the game of Reversi.

Hidden Rule 3:

 If you have an enemy piece “in between” when you achieve 1 and 2 above, a chain of events will occur.

 

Chapter 2.12

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

2.3

 

The next day

After the Titan Match.

 

The Mystic court of the Ruin Branch was lively and excited from the very morning.

 

Well, it is obvious.

In a game battle against God, Humans have come out victorious.

 

Since the last, about 35 days ago…

The rank of all the 18 apostle who participated in the game were increased by one.

[TL note: meaning Fei is now IV eh… humm humm]

 

Even the apostle’s degree of divine power, ‘Arise’, has increased.

But, above all;

It’s because there are simply happy.

 

“Since game is something that would make anyone happy when winning it regardless. So much so that the reward for that victory is just a secondary accomplishment. And yesterday, we were able to win a brain battle against God.” (Miranda)

 

“Each and every employee of this Mystic court are so happy about this victory that they just spread their wings in joy.“ (Miranda)

[TL note: the term spread your wings means being independent and free. Here this would mean completely letting loose of yourself and enjoying at the extent one can. The Japanese text also says something akin to this: 飛び跳ねる,which would mean jump, but when put in the sentence, I can’t find anything other than this idiom to satisfy its meaning completely.]

 

“And even I am no exception to that.” (Miranda)

 

“You would also spread your wings?” (Fei)

“Ah by that, you see, even if I am like this, I am having a position of a Head General in this association… So…”(Miranda)

“Well, setting that aside for now” (Miranda)

 

In the room of the office filled with the morning daylight…

The Head Manager dressed in suit, Miranda, touched the monitor located at the back.

 

“I praised till the point one should praise. So, now lets get back to the main subject…” (Miranda)

“Destroying the entrance door of the underground dive center of the Mystic court… Blackmailing the apostles who were standing, guarding it… Carrying out one of the only five Giant statues excavated till now without permission, on your own…” (Miranda)

“Let’s talk about that now.” (Miranda)

 

“……ah—” (Fei)

 

In response to that ‘Given-Up Gaze’ given by Miranda; Fei was left staring at the ceiling of the room.

 

Understood…

So, this was why I was called this early in the morning. Apparently, it was to scold me…

 

“Even if Reche did bring about the Giant stone statue from that place; I heard that she also put that back to its rightful original place after that though.” (Fei)

 

“That is right, but, if a part of the stone statue was damaged due to forcibly bringing it out from that place…” (Miranda)

 

“…………” (Fei)

“The cost of repair and maintenance fee alone is about fifty times the annual contract made with a new apostle. That…” (Miranda)

“That is not due to my fau—” (Fei)

“You are the over-looker of her actions.” (Miranda)

“…… true.” (Fei)

“You are supposed to stop her before she could do this. Isn’t that so?” (Miranda)

 

“Aren’t I in a checkmate then~?” (Fei)

It is impossible to escape from this…

 

So then, what to do?

Utilize my immortal body to make me participate in the precious and valuable human experiments and reimburse the cost for the mishaps…

[TL note: Welcome to the adult world boy… It is a norm here.]

 

Hmm… Let’s just run away before being told to continue doing such a thing.

 

“……Ah well, that’s all for my small lecture.” (Miranda)

Head General Miranda loosens her expressions putting aside her glasses, showing her naked pairs,

Something she would only show when she is in an incredibly good mood.

 

“It’s been a long time since I was able to enjoy watching a game. ‘Ahh I am so happy for them~’ or so was my reaction at that time.” (Miranda)

 

She turns on the Monitor.

 

What can into view, was a video of a Giant Titan who was approaching Fei while crushing, destroying the skyscrapers in its path.

 

Yesterday there was a large audience ranging from all around the globe. (Miranda)

“If considering this city alone, around seventy percent of the total populace were watching. Even for those who are not in this city at present, for them, right now I am rebroadcasting yesterday’s live broadcast.” (Miranda)

 

“Why do it to that extent?” (Fei)

 

“Because it got a huge response. See, outside from this window you can see too right~ the people aggregated in the city square.” (Miranda)

 

“Gods are beings who are invisible to normal people.” (Miranda)

 

However. When taking with them these filming equipment into the ‘Playground of the Gods’,

The equipment were seen to temporarily harness spiritual power too.

[TL note: it’s probably the reason why these equipments were able to capture the recordings of spiritual beings like Gods.]

 

“Thanks to these video recording equipments taken by apostles, the citizens, including me; we are able to watch the ‘Play of Gods’ from this world, the real material world.” (Miranda)

“We are also able to give our support to the human apostles fighting in the battle.” (Miranda)

 

“This is also an important thing you know~.” (Miranda)

 

The apostles carry these filming equipment at the time when going into the ‘Playground of Gods’.

So as to broadcast the battle confrontation with the spiritual Gods in real time.

 

With the incorporation of this type of entertainment in this world, the Mystic court makes loads and loads of money.

“Thanks to that, we are also accumulating lots of wealth. With this wealth, we are able to hire more and more apostles, even train them. And thus, we are able to fund for the investigation done and the exploration of the outer world.” (Miranda)

 

For example, even the Giant statues were found through exploration.

 

Those statue, which connects the material world to the spiritual world, cannot be reproduced even with the current modern technology.

The search for the ruins, the artifacts of that Great Civilization of Magic, and extracting these artifacts.

Then bringing them over here. There was no other way. [TL note: no other way by which they could go to those upper spiritual realms, into the Playground of Gods.]

 

Even during those exploration, in this world were creatures like dinosaurs would come running when taking just a single step out into the wilderness.

Thus, the need of assembling an exploration survey corps strong enough to withstand them.

 

Well, to do that, obviously, money is involved. [TL note: MONEI!]

 

“Thus, on this note, we would have to have our apostles work to their best abilities. If we, humans don’t win against Gods in these brain battles, the future of us humans is surely bleak.” (Reche)

 

‘…… Isn’t that story, quite long?” (Fei)

 

“Then, why not talk about your own story.” (Miranda)

Head General puts back her glasses.

 

“How was the ‘Tag’ game with Leo Reche?” (Miranda)

“How? like?” (Fei)

 

“Wasn’t it like, both of you were in a perfect sync with each other?” (Miranda)

“You were even able to have a link with her to a degree that cannot even come in comparison-close to all those rush teams you participated with.” (Miranda)

“Especially, like at the time when you two separated into different ways in the department stores.” (Miranda)

 

“———–” (Fei)

 

“O~ya what happened?” (Miranda) [xD]

 

“…… truth be told, I, even myself am in awe. What should I even say…other than that, ’it was incredible’…” (Fei)

 

No matter how hard the situation was, how hard the thoughts were, no matter how complicated our ideas were, our calculations or even our plans…

 

If it was she, she could, she matched it all. There was not even any need of conversing with each other.

Just a single line of sight between us, we could comprehend each other easily, verily, and work accordingly.

That too, in such a degree—

 

To think that there could be anyone with whom I could link my thoughts so well.

 

“It’s not like that all teams I participated with were no good. It is definitely not that…… It’s just that, as expected from a former God, just that…” (Fei)

 

“I don’t know if that is all though.” (Miranda)

“eh?” (Fei)

 

“I don’t think it is ‘as expected from a former God’. It is because it was you, Fei, and Leo Reche-sama together, that this was possible – or so I think.” (Miranda)

 

Head General Miranda mischievously laughs,

even her eyes laughing behind those spectacles.

 

“In case of Leo Reche-sama, till the time you were not here, she would just play alone, by herself.” (Miranda)

 

“All alone?” (Fei)

 

“There were no one strong enough you see. Trumps, Go, Roulette all alone. Well, sometimes me and other apostles tried to become her opponent. But, we weren’t even able to stand our own ground.” (Miranda)

 

“……ah.” (Fei)

“That is why Fei, it is only because it is you.” (Miranda)

As someone who can match her, a former God.

 

Someone who was victorious in the ‘Playground of Gods’ thrice in a row. A newcomer who set a record, never witnessed before in human history. [TL: well now isn’t it now four in a row?]

 

It was a perfect match.

Each of them seeked each other, just like the pieces of a puzzle.

 

“I think you two would become a good team.” (Miranda)

“Even your wish of conquering the ‘Playground of Gods’, isn’t it a step closer to your goal?” (Miranda)

 

“I will give it my all.” (Fei)

 

Chapter 2.13

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

The special advisory room in that floor is where Reche is given residence.

…… Come to think about it, didn’t I meet her for the first time just yesterday?

…… Because of playing together in the ‘Playground of the God’, it doesn’t actually feel like that though.

He opens the door,

To the very next corner after entering the room were her shoes loosely taken off from last night.

 “Reche~, you there?” (Fei)

“Un. Wait a bit~ I am in a good spot right now.” (Reche)

The voice came from the drawing aka living room.

Reche was sitting on the sofa wearing the same tank-top dress which she wore from yesterday morning, engrossed in the monitor in her hands.

The game: God-Pretend; with the giant God Titan.

“Over here, even though we ran into the department building, escaping to the shopping-district by turning right from there be also a good possibility, I think” (Reche)

“Are we going to do a reflection-session?” (Fei)

“Un. Next time let’s do this. Just think about it. Isn’t it exciting?” (Reche)

The former dragon God smiled innocently.

Without Fei himself understanding, he kept unknowingly staring at her side face.

“Oh well, let’s stop watching the re-broadcasted video for now.” (Reche)

“Is it okay?”(Fei)

“Well, I’ve rewatched it four times already.” (Reche)

“You’re watching that way too much!?” (Fei)

“But~ it was the first time I challenged the ‘Play Of Gods’ mon~.” (Reche)

“My excitement just doesn’t calm down.” (Reche)

Reche turned around towards Fei, sitting on top of the sofa.

“But isn’t it the same for both of us?” (Fei)

Reche sitting crossed leg looked up towards Fei with a mischievous look on her face.

“How was it~?, going against a God after a long time.” (Reche)

“…… It was obviously fun. I experienced the thrill after a long time.” (Fei)

The reason-battle against Gods can never be not fun.

And if allowed to say more, yesterday’s match was way more fulfilling than any of the last three God games played before.

Probably as much as I —

Nope, it was because she, the former God-sama, enjoyed the game even more than me.

…… Now, even during last night.., aren’t we together almost all the time?

…… It was only because she could become so engrossed and crazy about playing games.

That was why I could also enjoy it so much.

“———” (Fei)

“What’s wrong?” (Reche)

“Rather than thinking it as superficial, I would like you to hear it as a possibility; just yesterday, no apostle were laughing or were in a good mood. They all had a stiff expression on their face.” (Fei)

“Un” (Reche)

“In the eyes of other apostles, ‘The Play of Gods’ is not just a game. They would probably relate it to something close to work I guess. Just like how athletes think sports are, I think.” (Fei)

An apostle is someone who challenges God. They are heroes, and an idol.

They are humans who receive support and cheers from other fellow humans to challenge the ‘Play of Gods’. They are people who are asked for a sign when seen walking or roaming around the city.

Although, only till their active hours.

With their third defeat, that same apostle loses their right to challenge God.

Falling from their position as an idol, that is an apostle.

That fear of losing, losing their place, is a fear that is inhabited by each and every apostle here.

“I should not be defeated; everyone is working their hardest. I have a huge sense of responsibility behind my back. But that is just the upfront, when you put it inside-out…… When your team gets defeated, it’s always: ‘it was whose mistake’, ‘who should take responsibility,’ and then eventually it becomes a huge dispute. I am always a bit uncomfortable with that.” (Fei)

I don’t want that to happen.

“She” who taught me all about games, it is because she taught me to do just it’s opposite.

“Whether you win or lose: ‘It was fun wasn’t it? Let’s play again!’ to say that.” (Fei)

“That is mine and hers one and only promise —-” (Fei)

IT IS OKAY TO LOSE

Someone made a mistake, our luck wasn’t good enough, isn’t that’s why its called a game?

Such were my teachings from her.

“It’s a great feeling to be desired by God itself as an opponent in a game, and to think that there are more of such strong opponents out there; Just thinking about it makes my heart race. But well…. In the Mystic court, my opinion just remains a minority though.” (Fei)

Do you want to challenge Gods and win,

or,

Do you want to challenge Gods for just having fun.

That is the basic difference which remains between Fei and the other apostles about challenging Gods in the Mystic court, or so I thought.

Till he met Reche.

“—— However,”

Relaxing his shoulders, Fei could not help but have a big smile.

“Yesterday was really fun. Due to having to run so much throughout the game for a certain someone from somewhere, I could not even feel the heavy air in playing games at all.”

Well, the other apostles might have been quite tense though I guess.

But more than that, Reche kept running beside me all the time. It was so ecstatic.

 “…… But are you happy with the answer?” (Fei)

“Yep, I am very happy.” (Reche)

Reche stretched her legs forwards which was just moments ago cross legged.

She was constantly staring at Fei.

“Hey Fei. Do you have any desires?” (Reche)

[TL: carnal desires? The term used is “yokubo”]

“…… say what?” (Fei)

“Ah, it was a mistake for wish. You see, if it is me, ‘Return to being a God’ is a wish I have right~. So I was thinking whether Fei is kind of selfless or a wish-less type of person.” (Reche)

“I have too” (Fei)

“Aree? So unexpected.” (Reche)

Reche blinks her eyes in astonishment.

“Ehhh What What, Tell ME~~~!” (Reche)

“Even if you expect much from it, it is not that much of a great wish.” (Fei)

“HA!? … Don’t tell me.. A PERVERTED WISH~!” (Reche)

“HOW WOULD IT EVEN COME TO THAT?” (Fei)

 

“But, because boys of your age are all like that. It was even written in the magazine given by the Head Manager ~.” (Reche)

“God would become very sad if ‘it’ were asked to fulfil such a wish. Well, it’s not such a biggie for them. But well…. That is…..” (Reche)

Fei looked away from the Dragon God, Leo Reche, who had exactly the same facial and personality features as the girl/lady he had been searching for so~ long.

“…… I am searching for a person.” (Fei)

“Who?”(Reche)

“A person who always played games with me when I was little. I don’t even know the name of the person. I had always remembered calling her by ‘Onee-chan~’.” (Fei)

I was taught all about games by her.

I couldn’t beat her no matter how much I tried, no matter how many times I challenged her in my childhood. I challenged her every day, be it morning or night and she would happily accept my challenge.

“Let’s play again, Fei ~”

But one day, she suddenly disappeared.

Leaving with just a promise. A promise to meet again in future.

“…… I guess, it is someone you could call my teacher. I want to meet her again and express my gratitude to her.” (Fei)

“The way I am now-today is without a doubt all thanks to that person.” (Fei)

Even the three consecutive victories achieved in the ‘Play of Gods’; all because of her.

It was not because Fei was a genius. Nope; it was because of the thousands, tens of thousands times repeatedly losing to that ‘Onee-chan~’, which trained his spirit and body.

“With the complete victory of the ‘Play of Gods’, I would get the ‘Reward’ right.”

“My wish had always been just one. To find that person who used to play with me from that long time back.” (Fei)

“Fu~un, somehow, it’s really an interesting wish you have.” (Reche)

Reche starts pondering with her arms folded towards each other.

“But Fei, Don’t you have any leads to find that person? Other than only her liking for games?” (Reche)

“Well the thing is, I somehow do not remember her name, and even her face of voice is vague in my memories. But well, there is one thing that I clearly remember…—–” (Fei)

So as to say,

She looked just like Reche, especially her fiery flame colored hair that is.

The words which was about to come out, somehow stopped at my throat and didn’t come out.

“Don’t remember? Well, it doesn’t really matter, you can just wish that all together with a wish like ‘Please restore my memories’.” (Reche)

Reche jumps up from the sofa.

“Now then—” (Reche)

The fiery colored haired girl-goddess then reached out her hands to Fei with her best smile ever seen.

“I will return back to being a God. You will find that person who you are desperately searching for. A Team Is Then Formed!.” (Reche)

“YEAH, YOU GOT THAT COMING.” (Fei)

To those small hands,

Fei also puts forth his own hands and gives her a High Five.

“I promise to challenge with all my strength. Aiming at the tenth level of the ‘Play of Gods’ in mind.” (Fei)

 

Chapter 3.1

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

 

Chapter 3: Dropouts who want to quite the Game

The color of dawn spreads through the room as if dyed by ink.

In that coldness which would even freeze the air itself, the towns of the sacred city of Ruin were so silent as if the whole city itself was fast asleep.

In that time of dreadful silence —-

The 7th floor of the building, in one of those rooms…….

“Hey Head Manager, I have decided to form a team with Fei.”

“Oh, That is most welcome. Please aim for the complete victory over the ‘Play of Gods’.”

“Thus, I will be immediately heading off to the “Playground of Gods” right now then~”

“No can do ~”

“Why the heck!?”

The former God-girl screams at the top of her voice.

The hair as if burning brightly in red looked lovely with that well-organized cute face.

“If its me and Fei, we will win regardless you know?”

“Ye Ye, as long as Reche-sama and Fei-kun pairs up, without a doubt you two will be the best pair in our whole branch.”

“That is why, then we will be immediately participating in the next “Play of G—”

“Nope, denied ~”

“WHY ARE YOU DENYING IT!?”

And she screams again…

While the conversation between Reche and The Head Manager goes on. The said important person, Fei, was slurping down the herbal tea served onto him, working his mouth to chew those candies and cookies as along with it.

“Fei-kun~, its alright to have your way with those sweets… but what about the left-out explanation to Reche-sama?”

“Last night I spent my whole time explaining you know~, that it is impossible if its just the two of us”

The team of Fei and Reche.

Even if they were the ace in the whole, they can’t participate in the ‘Play of Gods’ all on their own.

“Even if they won during the ‘God-Pretend’, they played with God Titan. The ‘Play of Gods’ consists of a rule that allows it to be played, that is Gods versus a number of Humans.”

“With only the two of us, it is possible that the minimum participant number required to play the ‘Play of Gods’ cannot be met. Isn’t that right, Reche?.”

“Then how many people are required?”

“— Is what Reche is trying to ask. So, the approximate number required for participating in the ‘Play of Gods’ is better known by Head Manager Miranda, or so I remember. Also, there must be some statistical data showing the information with regard to this.”

And then this morning~

Being dragged by the intense motivation of Reche, I had to drop by the office room in the morning.

“Understood, as you said, if the apostles want to find the proof, then as one of the fellow office managers, I have to show them the numbers right~.”

Beyond those thin lenses of the spectacles, a pair of eyes rested, angered, even though they appeared smiling.

 

“However, look at the clothes I am wearing ~, are there any thoughts you would want to say aloud?”

“It’s a Gown right.”

“~Yep, a nightwear ~.”

A deep burgundy color. Indeed, She was wearing a really beautiful gown.

Although the eyes of the person asking, had her eyes incredibly drowsy, sleepy.

“I thought I would at last go to bed after this night shift. I had the thought that in just a few moments of time, I will be at last in my bedroom.”

“Sleep deprivation is a natural enemy of the skin of all the women out there you know.”

“I… I’m sorry……”

“The subordinates who committed the same mistake in the past had the punishment granted unto them of cleaning the courtyard of the building continuously for about a month.”

“It was like, even if a leaf would have fallen onto the ground, they would have had to re-clean the whole courtyard all over again.”

“It’s way too much!?”

 


 

“Because the sin of ruining a maiden’s sleep is very heavy to pay back. Be careful next time.”

With a serious sigh, the Head Manager in her gown poured some coffee in a cup and drank it all in one go.

“Well then Reche-sama, let’s talk about our present situation at hand; We, the Mystic Court, do not yet approve of your two-person team. The reason is as pointed out by Fei-kun, but if told more so about it, then it is because of the difference in winning percentage.”

“Muuu……”

“I guess even Reche-sama does also understand us somehow. Yes, the game battles with the Gods is basically a fight testing the extent of wisdom. The best move that a human should take would be: ‘Let the numbers do the talking’.”

The challenge against God is fixed to be one at a time.

On the other hand, in the case of the human side, no matter how many participate; For a God, the more the number of people challenging, the more the game would be merry, lively and fun to play.

So, from that we recommend.

“Each team in the Mystic Court should (must) be having ‘more than 10 people in it’. From the statistics calculated from more than 30 years, the victory percentage of people less than 9 in a team is even less than 4% in total, and when it is more than 10%, it suddenly rockets up to more than 10%. For more than 20 people, it was 11%. Thus, the conclusion. The more the number of participants participating together, the more is the chance of victory.”

“…………”

“To steal the victory from a being as big as a God, It is good to use the advantage of numbers.”

Reche remained silent with her cheeks inflated, *pouting.

While stealing a glance of that cute side face, Fei was smiling softly.

…… Even if she isn’t fully satisfied, her face shows that she cannot argue that logic.

…… From assessing the personality of Reche, if she is dissatisfied, she would always say it out aloud.

If you put forth a distorted reason in front of Reche, she would without doubt use all her power to rectify that false distorted reasoning.

But that did not happen.

From the point of view of Fei too, the words of Head Manager Miranda are very convincing.

“Then, how many people should I at least have? I, Fei, and how many more?”

It seems like a habit that developed due to continuous thinking.

While wrapping her flame-like hair continuously around her index fingers, the words escaped from the lips of the girl.

“I don’t care about how many numbers I would have to put in my team. But if I have to put people who have no love for the game, then its better to just pair with Fei alone.”

“Or is that feeling also mistaken?”

 

“Absolutely yes”

The Head Manager softly nods her head in agreement.

“Earlier, I did mention the number of people to be at least 10 in number; But if you can get along with at least three new apostle recruits little by little in time, I will give it a go sign.”

“Till then, you have to form an alliance with the teams who are also insufficient in numbers. Right~ Fei-Kun.”

“Yes?”

Hearing his name called out all of a sudden, he blinked his eyes in astonishment.

“Is ….. something the matter… with me…?”

“I entrust you to find a good apostle for Reshe then ~.”

“Is That My Job!? Isn’t that kind of thing a job for the associa……”

“In short, even you have to look for it. The work of the association office is only recruiting the amateur apostles to groups. I don’t know any apostles other than those who give excellent and objective end reports.”

In other words, those who give a critique point of view.

It is not uncommon for commentators, analysts, and actual professional players to be very divided in their evaluation of players in professional sports.

“Even Reche-sama is actually better than any apostle recommended by the Mystic court. The humans found by Fei-kun are more reliable and trustworthy right?”

“Un”

“If you answer so readily, I feel a bit lonely out here… Well, if you say so.”

Just as the conversations aka negotiations were coming to an end, Head Manager Miranda makes a long yawn.

“Now then, I will be going off to sleep. All that is left is Reche-sama and Fei-kun’s teammate hunt. It would be good if you were able to find good members right~?”

Chapter 3.2

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

3.2

The Mystic court

Into a building breathtakingly majestic, the 5th floor was the most lively out of all.

Well, the Dining hall and the café is free for all to use. However, the time of lunch is the most crowded.

Even though it was ten in the morning, there are almost no apostles here yet.

 

“Hey Fei,~, Where do I find a team mediator?”

“… Didn’t you just apply an electronic application for it in my room? Everyone can see that we are recruiting members from other terminals. If there is anyone desiring to join, they will contact us definitely.”

“?… Then why are we in this place just staying still…?”

In the seats of the café, Reche had an inflated cheeks due to boredom.

Let’s go back to our room fast and plaaaay ~, or so she seems to be telling with her eyes looking at me, but unfortunately, Fei had a reason for coming in this place.

“In the far back of the corridor, at the back of the window, there is definitely the Head Manager there. There at the consultation corner…”

From the corner of the café— Fei pointed towards the space to the far end of the corridor. Where he pointed was a small hall with some sofas and a round table.

“All team applications are electronically managed, but well, there are times, problems cannot be solved electronically. At that time, they are allowed to consult the clerk regarding it.”

“Whenever they want?”

“For example, when I feel like fighting with my teammates, or I joined the team, but the atmosphere is kind of different from what I expected, thus thinking of getting out of that team… For any problem like this, taking advice from friends is hard, but again you cannot solve the problem on your own. At that time, they can ask someone to hear their part of the story.”

“They are quite indecisive ne~”

“…… ANYWAYS, what we are trying to find out is whether any FA apostles would come there too or not. In other words, apostles who are looking out for a team to move into.”

Those who joined a team but left immediately. An apostle who is looking for another group to work with, and thus comes to that place frequently for consultation.

“I was thinking that if we continue to watch from this café, we might find someone who actually comes there. But well, it all comes down to luck. Well while I am waiting, I will try to find any other leads into this.”

“……Hmm-mm”

Reche puts her both hands on top of the table.

“Come to think of it, Fei came back here after half a year right? Before also there was a team you were into right? Is it noo good for us to be put into that team?”

“…… It’s practically impossible.”

“?”

 

“That team… due to reasons, got disbanded. There were various things that happened there, thus……”

I will tell ‘what’ to Reche too one day.

Fei too was just now thinking about the same thing at that time.

“Did they quarrel?”

“Nope never. Everyone was on good terms with each other.”

When the Rookie, Fei joined in; They were able to register three consecutive victories in the ‘Play of Gods’.

It was verily like a team which grew rapidly with momentum as if shooting down a flying bird off to the ground with its each shot.

“It was all of a sudden. One day when I entered the team-room, it was already decided to be disbanded.”

“Weren’t you not told about the reason for that decision?”

“Ah. Like telling me what I should be doing in the future? Like what direction I should go? Well at that very time, I was called by Miranda Head Manager telling that the girl I was looking for was found. Well, I thought it was a good opportunity to refresh my mind while also looking for the person I was looking for all these days.”

And well, thus I left the city, which was about half a year ago. The very reason I was away from the Mystic Court.

“It is unfortunate, but the team I was in is no longer there. Well, if I have to think about one, it would be the team of a fellow acquaintance perhaps~”

He then went towards the terminal of communications.

At this Mystic Court, the contact of dozens of apostles familiar to Fei are recorded.

“Just like the one from the other day, Asta-san, there are several apostles with whom I am acquainted with after playing in the ‘Play of Gods’ together. The first one then…….”

The Team, [In the Center of the World Storm]

It was a team with whom Fei got together twice while he was still a rookie. It was a team in which several apostles became acquaintances after the active role of Fei in winning.

“Ah, Hello. It’s been a long-time, Captain Aslan. Do you remember, I am ——-”

“ARE YOU FEI!?”

In just a short while after putting the phone onto his ears, A loud voice enough to actually tear the eardrum apart came from the other side of the phone.

Captain Aslan roars…

He has a rank of 3. In other words, he has defeated three Gods in the ‘Play of Gods’, A veteran of 16 year.

He has a personality of having several screws loose but is very passionate. He was the one who gave Fei consultation even when he was away.

“Oi Oi Oi Oi. You at last contacted me after so long!”

“Eh?”

“I saw the last live broadcast. When I was wondering where and what you are doing, you appeared suddenly challenging a God in the ‘Play of Gods’. Moreover, in an FA you don’t belong to!”

[TL note: I guess all his words are said in a LOUD voice.]

As expected of the information broker of his group.

After taking a look at yesterday’s Live broadcast, he was almost immediately able to know that I was with a team, not affiliated with.

…… Did he already know I was going to make a call to them?

…… As always, they are a really fast-acting group, well, he does least have a lot of motivation.

His responses,

With this exchange of words itself he conveys a really good positive feeling.

“It really helps that you know all the stuff beforehand. Well, to put it in short, I would like to talk about getting into your team captain.”

“Of course, you will be welcomed wholeheartedly. So, do you want to complete all the procedures as fast as today? Well, there is no actual reason to deny you.”

“With a former God known as Reche joining together~”

“Buhuhu—- Currently this communication line is out of use. Please enter the correct contact —-.”

“Hello Cap-!?”

“Wait for a minute Fei!? That Dragon God… That Dragon God together with you!? Well, I did also see that she was together with you in that Titan match but…”

Beyond the communication line, the captain gulps down his saliva. His tension is even felt across the line.

“The Dragon Leo Reche na…”

“What is wrong captain? Suddenly getting all stuck up…”

“……Do you know Fei..? That God… there were incidents where that God rampaged against humans before.”

“Eh? What are you talking about?”

While talking with Captain Aslan, Fei looks at the figure of Reche with her hands on top of the table across.

If it’s true that she has a good ear, she can hear this conversation going between us too.

“Hey Reche. Captain Aslan is saying something like this though.”

“…… Hmm? Now what are you talking about though?”

[TL note: Oh my god… no]

“Captain. Please tell the story in detail.”

“That God, she usually has the reputation of being cute and calm in the Mystic Court. But well, you do know what she did to those in charge of the ’Play of Gods’ right. Well, there is a role of dignity too, if anyone harms the dignity of the ‘Play of Gods’ you cannot just leave them alone right.”

“Hmm, And then?”

“And then, there was a team in the hallway, who just participated and lost in the ‘Play of Gods’, getting all down spirited. They got drunk up in ‘sake’ (rice-made alcohol) and shouted that the ‘THE PLAY OF GODS IS JUST A CRA*’. At that moment, by complete coincidence.”

“Reche was passing by, and got angry?”

“The news of 20 apostles sent to hospital… and later on, that incident, that case was called and known by the name of, ‘Blood-dyed God’ case.”

“Oi RESHE!?”

Gulp

The said culprit jumped off the chair all of a sudden.

As the fiery colored hair wavered, she had an expression of “I’m done for” in her face; backing off.

“I…I…, THAT DOESN’T IMPLY MYSELF BEING AT THE WRONG!”

“LIES! AND WHAT IS WITH THAT STRANGE LANGUAGE!”

“I… everything I conducted was none other than giving a hit unto their shoulders. THE TALKS OF SOMEONE GETTING INJURIES ARE ALL FALSE!”

Was the girl trying to denying the charges put against her…

 

Chapter 3.3

 

Translated by: Darkapta

 

 

But is it because of confusion or perhaps guilt, the language used happens to be very old.

 “—–Is what she is saying Captain~”

“The said apostles got eight complicated fractures diagnosed… They were even carried out by a stretcher out of the scene too you see…”

“Oi RECHE!?”

“WHA~!?”

Reche backs off even further.

However, there was a tinge of ‘giving up’ in the sight of Fei and his body language.

“It.. was done.. inadvertently. I misunderstood the world to be in a similar fashion to that of the spiritual upper world.”

 

“…… This ‘INADVERTENT’ God…”

Inadvertently fell asleep in the permanent ice wall for about 3000 years…

Inadvertently unable to return to Godhood… and

Inadvertently creating an incident of Bloodshed…

[TL note: LMAOOOO; Inadvertently means carelessly, by mistake.]

…… Did she get furious because ‘Play of Gods’ got ridiculed?

…… Well, I can actually imagine that even with my eyes closed. From the character of Reche.

There are no casualties, no deaths in the “Play of Gods”.

But this is not true for the real physical world. When I am with Reche, there is no guarantee of life if you manage to offend her even in the least.

The current matter too, if I had not taken the correct decision, this would have led to another catastrophe altogether.

“Head Manager Miranda, no wonder she chose me as the companion of Reche……”

“I am really sorry. Even though she is an incredibly-insanely cute girl, only if there were no complications or incidents to her name, I would have said ‘by all means yes’. Well speaking of luxury… If only she could have a chest a bit on the bigger si—.”

PIK~

The glass held by Reche suddenly made a sound and had a crack in it. A glass made up of reinforced ceramic… A glass which should not have any cracks or breakages easily…

“Reche?”

“The size of the chest depends from person to person”

The girl had a smile on her face…

“When I decided to choose this form you know~ I did not know the tastes of a human man as such… Even when I was about to embody this appearance, it was easier to imitate a straight body feature. And so, I thought it would be perfectly fine or so. But boys like b*****s to be on the bigger side, don’t they?”

“…… No… even if you ask me…”

“Even during the time of the Ancient Magic Civilization too, I remember being rumored that despite being a God, my chest is quite modest right…”

“At that time, I became so angry that I was about to burn down the entire world into crispers.

“Are you Planning to wipe Humans Out!?”

“—Fei.”

With a very lovely smile, having her both arms crossed under her chest, she tries her best to push forward her two rugged twin hills.

“You.., you don’t mind much about the size of a woman’s chest right? I mean, I still have quite a decent amount in me, right?.”

“…………”

“What do you say?”

“…… Yes, truly, you are indeed correct.”

… Strange…

Even though we should be looking for a teammate, why am I having cold sweats being asked about my impressions about the size of the breast of the opposite s*x.

And have to answer those questions no matter what…

“Good then”

Reche nods her head satisfied.

By the way, regarding the call with the said person who supposedly touched this sensitive topic – it had been already disconnected.

…… That Captain Aslan, he immediately ran away the moment he got a thought of this to be extremely dangerous.

…… I will give him an earful later on.

“Alright Fei, Let’s continue our search for teammates~ But a condition. It must be a person with a smaller chest than mine.”

“AS IF I KNOW ANY!?”

I look into the contact registry in the list of the communication device. Looking at the accomplishments, desires and qualification requirements of various teams. He combines and evaluates them from his own perspective.

“Reche~ the next I would be contacting will be a Lady Captain. Is it alright?”

“If she has a chest smaller than mine then it’s all good.”

“As I said, I don’t know any such person. ………. Ah, Excuse me, Captain Yuki? How are you doing? It is I, Fei. But is the time now alright?”

“Ara maa~ isn’t it Fei~ Long time~”

A reply comes from the communication device.

What reached Fei’s ears was a feminine voice which might actually belong to a really s**y adult woman.

“At long last are you feeling like respond to my date invitation right~”

“No? not at all”

“Now aren’t you so cold~ well I did think you would say so…… A, Also, I also saw that live broadcast of the Titan game in front of the monitor. Me and my fellow members were shouting and having a lot of fun watching that match, and giving out our own judgements.

“Even you, Captain?”

“That is one of my job damon~”

*kusu, or so, a mature laugh is transmitted over from the other side of the communication device.

“There is no certain winning method for the ‘Play of Gods’ but there was a solution, nonetheless. After watching the Play with Gods, finding out other effective paths or methods which could’ve been taken is also very important. I have an excellent game analysis team with me. After all, I left the hard work to them and continued to enjoy watching the game.”

“Well, the team of Captain Yuuki; the whole team is a complete set ne~.”

The team, [The Beautifully Blooming Black Wild Roses] is a total of 36-member team.

There are in total 14 active apostles, there are 4 retired apostles giving advice and 4, discussing game solutions and analyzing. There were 10 newcomers who came into the team this year, now in training. And there are 2 managers.

The role of guiding the newcomers is the task of the previous Captain.

And when you add Captain Yuuki to the fray, you get a total of 36 people.

The most important thing for having a greater chance of winning in the ‘Play of Gods’ is having an excellent Game Analysis team.

The team’s main role is to derive possible winning methods from the contents of the past played games.

In case of the game by God Titan, ‘God-Pretend’ too—

That game was watched by the whole world, in a live broadcast.

If there is an excellent Game Analysis team, there must have been a fast discussion regarding ‘What could be done to dominate the game such as God-Pretend’ definitely.

Participated by the other staff too.

Their extraordinary leaders and advisors are invited by various other teams and solicited with exceptional rewards.

“Regarding Captain, even in this year’s Mystic Court you got an ‘A’ in examination right~.”

“Of course. Ara Fei, are you finally interested in my [The Beautifully Blooming Black Wild Roses]? Just to tell you, we have a lot of apostles who try to get in but are unable to ok?”

“And m—?”

“I will get an open seat for especially you right this moment~”

… it was miraculously answered even before completing.

“While watching the match with the God Titan, I trembled in excitement after a long time. And to say also, the Titan would always without doubt choose a game related to fighting.”

 “But this time, it was ‘God-Pretend’…”

“There is no derived solution for the first game of its kind, so even my analysis team became pale faced. And to achieve victory over such a game, that too all of a sudden.”

“It is not because of ‘just me’ you know.”

“Aren’t you humble~. Well so that’s that. If Fei wants to come into our team, we will welcome you in open arms. Manager~, Please order a desk and a locker for a person in the room immediately.”

“Ah…… wait a bit Captain Yuuki. It is not just me.”

In front of Fei—-

Reche was listening to the conversation between them with great interest.

“Can you get a place for one more person?”

“Your recommendation? It’s okay, but who is it?”

“A former God named Leo Reche. She is at present right in front of me. She has bright red hair… but well it’s not even required to say right.”

“…………”

“Arre? Hello? Captain Yuuki? Captain? Are you there?”

All of a sudden, the voice coming from the other side of the communicating device stopped.

Not only the voice of Captain Yuuki, but also the happy-lively voices of member apostles which came from around her too.

Isn’t it as calm as if in the water of a water body no stones were struck for a time?

“Captain Yuuki?”

And then…

“DRAGON GOD LEO RECHE YOU SAY!? n… N..NOOOOOOOOOO—-”

And the communication is cut off abruptly.

The communication device at the end of Fei had become completely silent.

“Arrere? They hung up.. Oh right, Reche~ the moment I said your name to Captain Yuuki’s demeanor suddenly changed to the point of screaming and then abruptly cutting off the communication device.”

 

“…………”

“Why are you looking away~?”

The cute and lovely girl was then turning away her face and her line of sight, being aware of her nearby surroundings, figuring out her way to escape.

And then…

 

Chapter 3.4

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

Looking at her back appearance, Reche crosses her arms still continuing to look at her.

“Say Fei, don’t you think the Space Transition that just now occurred, maybe came from the floor below.”

“If that is so, then it’s really commendable. To jump past a floor, that too, the one below from here, that is a really good distance.”

“So, is that child also applying for FA?”

“That is really unusual though. A Teleport ability user is a very convenient ability, even in the ‘Play of Gods’ they often play a very useful role. Even before she would go to FA, it is quite normal for some other team to have called out to her though……”

Spatial Transition is an ability which falls under the typical type of Teleportation supernatural ability.

An ability to walk through in between the spaces of relativity. [TL note: Worn holes I guess]

For example, even against the game played against Titan, ‘God-Pretend’, if there would have been a teammate holding a similar or same power, one could definitely move from in-out the building freely and escape easily.

“Fei! That child is trying to call out to that counselor there.”

“You’re right. If she were trying to look for a team, the timing between us is just about right.”

I try to approach her.

That blonde though is yet to notice the existence of Fei and Reche. Taking out the tri-folded paper from the envelope, she was about to pass it on to the other side of the window panel.

Resignation

Or so was written in the application form.

“……. Peal Diamonds, As of today, I will be retiring.”

“WAIT FOR A MINUTE!?”

And then…

A fire fired from the very hands of Reche went up and swallowed up the resignation letter that the girl had held up in her hands.

*Bo~tsu;

In an instant it got converted to black charcoal.

“Hmm. As Expected Of The Great Me, I Did A Good Job.”

“WA.AWA.WA.WA. WHAT GOOD JOB WAS THAT!? AND WHAT WAS WITH THAT FIRE JUST NOW, YOU WERE ABOUT TO BURN MY BANGS ALSO WITH IT!”

The blonde girl, who was perhaps known as Pearl, Screamed.

“Ah… I need to check my….. letter ……… is …….. a, arree?”

The girl’s dot like eyes blinked in confusion.

A hole, wide enough to see the faces of both Reche and me together was now present in it.

“…… Somehow, the faces look really similar to that Ryuujin-sama and that last year’s most accomplished rookie apostle Fei.”

[Tl note: Ryuujin=Dragon God, I thought I would just leave it at that; Sorry for the trouble.]

“Rather than similar, we are the very persons though”

“Hyaa!?”

And jumped to make a distance.

“I AM SORRY! To say something this rude unknowingly to celebrities, I am really sorry!”

“…… Nope, not at all. that was not at all rude~.”

“I will apologize for it by resigning.”

“AS I am saying CAN YOU NOT TAKE SUCH RASH DECISIONS!? Wait… WAIT A BIT! PLEASE! I BEG YOU!”

Grabbing her shoulders which slumped as if it were the end of the world, Fei called unto her with the best of his ability.

“Calm down for a bit. We are actually on the side of ‘trying to stop your retirement’!”

Well, it is not a statement which I, who went on a sudden long leave, should be saying though—-.

NO APOSTLE CAN RETIRE VOLUNTARILY.

In the first place, the fact that an apostle can remain an apostle is only till the three losses in the ‘Play of Gods’. If we talk about the period (by which almost all accumulate three losses), it’s somewhere around 2-3 years.

…… Even if you are being treated as an Idol, if you are not able to win against the Gods, you will face immediate retirement (after 3 loses).

…… It is said to be a carrier which feels like a shining firework, but for only a limited amount of time.

That is the very reason why citizens desperately support and cheer for the Apostle and their victory.

“The treatment to the Apostle who have lost three games in active service is indeed ‘retirement’ but trying to ‘retire’ as written in the envelope. Does that mean that sempai is yet to lose three battles?”

[TL note: the first retirement{退役} refers to being retire from active service, while the second retire meaning voluntarily retire{引退}; the kanjis are different for both]

“…………”

“Even though you still have the right to challenge God to games left with you, why are you thinking of ending your career as an apostle altogether?”

“…… I can’t say the reason.”

And the blonde girl looked down to the ground.

But however, the team of Fei was trying to recruit, looking for team members to include in their teams. They are not just going to sit down and back off from this opportunity.

“To put it short and frankly, we are looking for apostles to include in our FA–.”

“It’s impossible.”

“At least just hear me out.”

“I am really sorry.”

 

Guha~… the.. then, let’s see… I will treat you to a parfait at the café there! While completing eating it out, won’t you give some of your time to tell you my circumstances. I guess it will still be a no…”

“Alright.”

“IT’S ALRIGHT!?”

While having an expression telling as if it is the end of the world itself, the girl named Pearl surprisingly replied with an unexpected vigor.

[TL: it’s the parfait…]

3.3

Pearl Diamonds,

16 years old.

‘Play of Gods’ statistics: 1 win, 1 loss

Hobby: To make food balanced and rich in nutrients.

‘Arise’ blessing: Supernatural Type – Ability to Teleport

But the reason for that dull expression was, Pearl herself identifies the usage of this ability as for a ‘Whimsical Traveler’.

While the ability in itself, is Powerful.

All Rank-I Apostles, no matter how insignificant their divine power is in the real world, in them, the space-transition apostles have to do their utter best to even have their ability extend till a few meters afar. In that scenario, it’s actually faster to just walk to that place.

…… But that was not the case with Pearl.

…… Even though she was still just a Rank-I apostle, she teleported past a whole floor of the building and arrived here.

Even from the point of view of Fei himself, it was a power to reckon with.

And the reason for such a promising young apostle, deciding to retire prematurely was presumably—-

“I think I understand your situation now”

She was able to calm down a bit. Pearl slowly muttered away her story to Reche and Fei.

What Fei understood was thus:

“Because of her fault, the whole team was annihilated. And so, you got disgusted with yourself.”

“Y…es….. I am really… just no good.”

“I am just a bad fortune who just keeps on failing…… Aaah, this strawberry parfait… can I order another one?”

“…… Go on..”

Pearl gestures pointing out to the menu table.

As expected of someone having a hobby as cooking. No matter how depressed they are, whenever they would be eating something, they would automatically feel happy again.

“So, when I organize your story… During the ‘Play of Gods’ game battles, when you were almost trampled by that giant God, in that fear, you unconsciously activated your ability. Which was not just any teleport—“

“It’s a Phase Teleport.”

 

“Ohhh, That one heh. That which is supposed to have all kinds of various wide range applications, or so I heard.”

Chapter 3.5

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

“It’s a Phase Teleport.”

 

“Ohhh, That one heh. That which is supposed to have all kinds of various wide range applications, or so I heard.”

“It’s really useless I am Telling You!”

Pearl Diamonds’ ability to transfer are of two types:

 

1.      A simple Teleportation,

Which as Fei also saw earlier, connects two faraway places together with a ring, and transfers objects and peoples from one place to that adjoined place.

While the second is:

 

1.      Phase Teleport.

An ability which would swap the current location of Human A and Human B.

“And she activated that ‘Phase Transfer’ the moment she was about to get trampled by the God. Thus, she interchanged the positions of hers and the captain, and as a result, the captain got trampled by the God and got taken out, retired out of the game.”

“It is exactly as you said. The moment I thought I was about to get trampled, I… I got really scared…… and activated my powers without thinking about anything else……”

Pearl was able to survive.

But unfortunately, due to the battle rule of that game, “’Protect your leader’ – thus the whole team was declared defeated.

And due to that, all those apostles whose total lost game became ‘3’ in total, got retired.

Pearl was thus an ‘Ally killer’. Unable to withstand the guilt of that feeling, she retired from the team.

This was the Background.

 “I am a real scaredy-cat, and on top of that, clumsy. The only victory I was able to secure was also only because of the team. I had always created trouble for my teammates; it’s natural for me to have no place anywhere forever.”

“—forever heh.”

Leaning on top of the table with her cheeks supported, Reche stares at Pearl.

With an extremely sharp gaze, as if throwing knives at her.

“ArE YOu MakInG A foOL Of tHe ‘Play of Gods’?”

“Waa, HAI~ii”

“A team having a member who is actually clumsy and drags down the other members of the team can never possibly win the “Play of Gods” under any circumstances whatsoever. The Gods are not so easy of a target. The moment you are able to grasp even one victory proves that you are not what you describe yourself to be.”

“Eh?”

“You were not a drag down for the team, is what I think though.”

“Tha—That’s….!”

Finally understanding the meaning behind the words of the dragon god, the depressed heartbroken girl uplifts her head.

“So, you are named “Pearl”, am I right?”

“Yes, Leo Reche-sama……”

As her name was spoken out, Pearl put strength on her shoulders and corrected her posture.

“Well fret not, even if your actions might drag us down, that won’t matter in the least. I and Fei alone can do something about this “Play of God” nevertheless. As long as the count of numbers can be met. If it concerns you too much, it’s fine if you just participate and retire the very next moment.”

“THERE IS A LIMIT TO BEING STRAIGHT ON TO THE FACE…”

“I hate lies.”

“Mou! At least make it a bit (more) gentler! PLEASE!.”

“And on the contrary; even if we happen to lose, you won’t try to dump the fault on to your teammates. That includes me and Fei alike.”

“…………”

“So~”

Reche, who returned to her charming smiling face, extended her hands out to her.

“Let’s try it once for now? If you join now, you can get the complete enjoyment, all for free free free! It’s really easy. Once you try it out, you will definitely find it addictive, never unable to stop ever again.”

“IS THIS SOME KIND OF SHADY DEAL!?”

“Muuu… inviting humans seems really hard of a job ne……”

“Any-ANYWAY!”

Pearl stands up vigorously.

“I’ve already decided upon this! That I will leave becoming an Apostle and start a new life altogether! Therefore, I AM TERRIBLY SORRY!”

And thus, she turned towards the door of the café and started to run towards it.

and then eventually collides with the wall?

Or so what everyone in the store anticipated, when suddenly a teleportation ring appeared glowing in a different light, as she left the café going in through that.

“I wonder if we should go after her. Ah… the teleportation ring closed up.”

Looking at the wall where the ring was just now seems to close up, Reche sighs.

“Un un. I think it cannot be helped. Let’s try to get hold of another child.”

“…….”

“Arre? Fei?”

While looking at the void from where Pearl seems to have disappeared from, Fei returned his gaze towards Reche.

“Let’s dig out some information.”

“About What?”

“Regarding the room no. of the girl’s dorms where she is currently staying. If she is trying to retire, then it is probable that she has definitely cleaned up her room too. We have to stop her fast.”

“Eh?”

Reche’s eyes turned dots as it blinked in confusion.

Let’s leave our chances with that girl and let’s try out our luck with someone else. While she was thinking along these lines. The words which came out of Fei’s mouth were certainly shocking and surprising.

“I just have a feeling like, if we make her end like that, it will surely be a waste.”

“If she ended it here, she would be forever scared of playing games. Don’t you think that would be a shame?”

“……Ah.”

Reche’s eyes suddenly widened.

Following which, a slight bit of joy manifested in her, as her mouth turned up to a smile.

“Fine then. If that’s your reasoning then even I am all in for it.”

“Right? It’s just a feeling that, just once more, I want to stop her from her decision. After that, I will leave the last say to her.”

With a small nod getting in confirmation, Fei turned and started walking faster.

Chapter 3.6

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

And then…

“…… I did not do anything”

“WhAt tHe HECK diD You Do!?”

“Iii…iii..iiit..tt.. IT IS A MISUNDERSTANDING; I HAVE NOT DONE ANYTHING!”

“LIES!!!”

I wrap around the girl who was about to turn and run away.

“Reshe…. You…, So You are the type whose words come out as soon as they are conflicted huh. AND what’s more suspicious is when your tone turns into that of a very upset kamisama (God)!.”

“That type cannot be the truth!”

“There IS SUCH A THING RIGHT~! You should be familiar with the name of the Captain who goes by the name of Yuuki… Now try and Tell me Honestly what the heck did you do now…”

“……UwU, UUUUUU, Uhhhh……”

Reche, who was yet hesitant to speak, let her eyes’ sight float in the air for a while.

“In a Long Long back, at some place —-”

“Now That’s a LONG BACK Story now!? Or are you trying to fool me by making it like a story which ‘Already rests in history’ !”

“I… I UndeRSTAND OKAY……”

Reche, who lost in all fronts, gives up and sighs.

Still unable to look at Fei directly, with an expression of someone in the wrong on her face,

“Uh…umm… I actually was really free for the last half a year. I would choose a good and healthy looking Apostle and play with them in the underground colosseum. It would also become a practice for the humans competing against Gods too right~”

“In order to pass time heh. And? after that?”

“And well, among the first names that popped up, there was kind of like a name like Yuuki or so I think. IT’S BECAUSE I STILL DIDN’T YET KNOW HOW TO HOLD BACK, so there were about to be serious victims due to that issue……”

“So… Captain Yuuki was among the ones who were TRAUMATISED FOR LIFE BECAUSE OF THAT!?”

After taking that unmanageable power of a God in its complete wholeness and still able to survive is commendable in itself. However, even though wounds would heal in time, scars would remain for life.

“B.. But I did properly go to see her recover! I also took a lot of sweets with me too!”

“Hou, So then~?”

“She screamed at the top of her voice and fainted.”

“What would you do by adding up to the trauma scarred to her heart!?”

ARGHhhh this is beyond hope…

This Dragon God Reche, if so to speak, is a lion in a zoo.

She is fun to watch from far away, but no one would dare to approach without having a cage in between.

She might be recognized by them as that kind of animal idol kind of thing.

“…… Now I see. If it becomes like this, getting into an existing team would become really difficult huh.”

Since…

The former God cannot control her turbulent self.

However, that point of view, if taken into consideration from Fei’s perspective, will be half correct as well as half off.

The former God just wants to play with humans, trying to understand the creatures known as humans, and the biggest proof of this theory is the large amount of books accumulated in her room.

“Sorry Fei…… I am somehow… really sorry Fei……”

“…… It’s all okay”

Fei pats the head of Reche who was unusually depressed, and gets up from his seat.

“Let’s patiently look for a new team member. Even if we are unable to join any existing team, we can just form a new team all by ourselves.”

“The ‘F~ A~’ that you mentioned earlier, is?”

“Oh, right, right. It’s not uncommon to find an apostle looking for a new working team.”

In the Mystic Court, Ruin Branch alone, there are approximately a total of thousand and two hundred apostles present.

One can actually find on a daily basis, someone or other looking for a team to join to, declaring their FA and giving their personal details and performance records to the existing personnel of the team.

“And that advice center is located at that place across that corridor. If you continue to have a keen eye on that place, you can actually find someone going there.”

“……Hmmm?…”

Reche starts staring vaguely at the end of the corridor.

“Hey Fei, Let me tell you this just one time, I am not interested in companions just to fulfil the number of people required to enter. I want people who actually love to play games wholeheartedly.”

“Even for me. It has to be a person who can understand me and vice versa.”

 

Someone who just loves playing games.

Someone who would even forget what time it is, and just immerse themselves in games, and after immersing themselves, even if they become free, think of other ways, strategies to win the game.

Was the number one condition Fei would definitely want his team member to have.

“……Also, this is relatively my own selfishness but, there must be one more condition added.”

“Which?”

“To have an ability which can be useful in the ‘Play of Gods’. For example, in the case of Reche, suppose you have two Supernatural-type apostles in the team, one is a flame type and the other is a water type. If both were the same in usage of their powers, who would you choose?”

“Undoubtedly The Flame one!”

“But why~?”

“Because I am the God of Fire! THAT IS WHY!”

I thought she might say this.

Because Reche is a Dragon God of Fire, she would definitely want to choose based on that familiarity…

 

“Boo-Boo. The answer would be “The Ice Type.”

“BUT WHY!?”

Reche’s cheeks swelled up as if she were a small child.

“That has to be FIRE! Because just look at how super strong I am!”

“Flame or Fire is just energy in the end, and Ice is material. That is the difference.”

“Hai?”

“In the ‘Play of Gods’, The Flame type magician cannot be used in battles other than combat alone. Thus, in short, they will become an incredible power to reckon with BUT only when in a team with Kamisama.”

“…… Then what about the Ice one?”

“In the case of Ice, we can use it to make walls or stairs of ice right? After all, ice is physical, a solid material in the end.”

While playing the game of Tag with The God Titan —- [TL note: here the author says Onigokko instead of Kamigokko]

If there had been an apostle of ice on the side of Fei, they could have made a new escape route by constructing and connecting ice-bridges with one building to another.

The person with ice-type magic, even apart from the actual game itself, can be easily made to play an active role.

“Will it be easier to understand if I were to say it as an Ability for Practical Use? The games with Gods are of many, many kinds, some happening simultaneously. Thus, having an apostle with useful abilities as your teammate.”

“……Muu~. Truly so.”

Reche sighs ‘yare-yare’ having her hands folded.

“Anyways, if I am there, all games are just a walk in the park. So then, it would be better to have an apostle whose power would be useful in other games, is what you mean?”

“Ah yes. Though those apostles would be fighting with other teams though.”

“Fu~un? And by the way, what type of ability would Fei want to have in his team?”

“What I can think, the ability I can think of right away would be, like for example Telepor—”

Just in the very moment…

Just above, the atmosphere distorted with a ‘Bu~on~TsU’ buzzing sound. And with a quick succession, a rainbow colored ‘ring’ appeared in void. From the other side of that donut shaped ring, footsteps of someone is heard.

It was indeed the same ability which I just now said—–

“A SPACE TRANSITION!?”

“Fei, that place is dangerous there, you know.”

Being pulled by Reche, Fei stepped back two steps.

In front of Fei, the sound of her light footsteps reverberating, a lovely girl appeared in front of him jumping through the shining ring from the other side.

…… A Teleportation ability User!

…… There was no presence of her moments ago. Did She Move Here From Another Floor Altogether!

A girl having light blonde hair.

Even though somewhat shorter in height than Reche, You can actually see the bountiful feminine growth just by looking at the bulges and curves on the prescribed Mystic Court clothes worn by her. Her fuzzy and lovely look is also just too adorable.

Such a girl had an incredibly sad expression expressed on her face.

“Someone you know, Fei?”

“Nope, not at all. It looks like she didn’t even notice us at all.”

That blonde girl was taking good care of a sealed letter. Perhaps desperately for that, unable to even notice the very person standing behind her.

And then proceeds to go straight towards the consultation desk.

“…… Oh?”

Looking at her back appearance, Reche crosses her arms still continuing to look at her.

————————-CHAPTER END————————————

“Say Fei, don’t you think the Space Transition that just now occurred, maybe came from the floor below.”

“If that is so, then it’s really commendable. To jump past a floor, that too, the one below from here, that is a really good distance.”

“So, is that child also applying for FA?”

“That is really unusual though. A Teleport ability user is a very convenient ability, even in the ‘Play of Gods’ they often play a very useful role. Even before she would go to FA, it is quite normal for some other team to have called out to her though……”

Spatial Transition is an ability which falls under the typical type of Teleportation supernatural ability.

An ability to walk through in between the spaces of relativity. [TL note: Worn holes I guess]

For example, even against the game played against Titan, ‘God-Pretend’, if there would have been a teammate holding a similar or same power, one could definitely move from in-out the building freely and escape easily.

“Fei! That child is trying to call out to that counselor there.”

“You’re right. If she were trying to look for a team, the timing between us is just about right.”

I try to approach her.

That blonde though is yet to notice the existence of Fei and Reche. Taking out the tri-folded paper from the envelope, she was about to pass it on to the other side of the window panel.

Resignation

Or so was written in the application form.

“……. Peal Diamonds, As of today, I would be retiring.”

“WAIT FOR A MINUTE!?”

And then…

*Bo~tsu;

In an instant it got converted to black charcoal.

“WA.AWA.WA.WA. WHAT GOOD JOB WAS THAT!? AND WHAT WAS WITH THAT FIRE JUST NOW, YOU WERE ABOUT TO BURN MY BANGS ALSO WITH IT!”

The blonde girl, who was perhaps known as Pearl, Screamed.
