The girl’s dot like eyes blinked in confusion.

A hole, wide enough to see the faces of both Reche and me together was now present in it.

“…… Somehow, the faces look really similar to that Ryuujin-sama and that last year’s most accomplished rookie apostle Fei.”

[Tl note: Ryuujin=Dragon God, I thought would just leave it at that; Sorry for the trouble.]

“Rather than similar, we are the very persons though”

“Hyaa!?”

And jumped to make a distance.

“I AM SORRY! To say something this rude unknowingly to celebrities, I am really sorry!”

“…… Nope, not at all. that was not at all rude~.”

“I will apologize for it by resigning.”

“AS I am saying CAN YOU NOT TAKE SUCH RASH DECISIONS!? Wait… WAIT A BIT! PLEASE! I BEG YOU!”

Grabbing her shoulders which slumped as if it were the end of the world, Fei called unto her with the best of his ability.

“Calm down for a bit. We are actually on the side of, trying to stop your retirement!”

Well, it is not a statement which I, who went on a long leave, should be saying though—-.

NO APPOSTLE CAN RETIRE VOLUNTARILY.

In the first place, the fact that an apostle can remain an apostle is only till the three losses in the ‘Play of Gods’. If talked about the period (by which almost all accumulate three losses), its somewhere around 2-3 years.

…… Even if you are being treated as an Idol, if you are not able to win against the Gods, you will face immediate retirement (after 3 loses).

…… It is said to be a carrier which feels like a shining fireworks, but for only a limited amount of time.

That is the very reason, why citizens desperately support and cheer of Apostle and their victory.

“The treatment to the Apostle who have lost three games in active service is indeed ‘retirement’ but trying to ‘retire’ as written in the envelop. Does that mean that sempai is yet to lose three battles?”

[TL note: the first retirement{退役} refers to being retire from active service, while the second retire meaning voluntarily retire{引退}; the kanjis are different for both]

“…………”

“Even though you still have the right to challenge God to games left with you, why are you thinking of ending your career as an apostle altogether?”

“…… I can’t say the reason.”

And the blonde girl looked down to the ground.

But however, the team of Fei was trying to recruit, looking for team members to include in their teams. They are not just going to sit down and back off from this opportunity.

“To put it short and frankly, we are looking for apostles to include in our FA–.”

“It’s impossible.”

“At least just hear me out.”

“I am really sorry.”

 

Guha~… the.. then, let’s see… I will treat you to a parfait at the café there! While completing eating it out, won’t you give some of your time to tell you my circumstances. I guess it will still be a no…”

“Alright.”

“IT’S ALRIGHT!?”

While having an expression telling as if it is the end of the world itself, the girl named Pearl surprisingly replied with an unexpected vigor.

[TL: it’s the parfait…]

Chapter 3.7

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

 

 

4.        

The Next Day

On the Grounds of The Mystic Court OF Ruins ——

“Hey Fei, are you sure this is the right aisle?

“If it’s the same as the boys’ dorm, this’s probably the right one. After all, it took us a whole day to check Pearl’s room thoroughly, so we’d better hurry.”

 With Reche in the lead, Fei was walking just behind her.

 There were two apostle dormitories in total.

And the dormitories being walked in by Fei and Reche was the one dedicated especially for girl’s out of the two.

Because it was in the daytime, the number of people present were quite less. But the fact that a boy is walking around the girl’s dormitories is probably looked in suspicion, nevertheless, there were many girls among them present there, who had their eyes turned towards them.

“I am really thankful that Reche is with me at present. If I was alone, I would definitely be looked upon and treated as a really suspicious person.”

“Fei… I have been meaning to ask this for a long time since now. Why are the apostle dormitories being divided specifically between the woman and the man camps in the first place?”

Reche, who was walking in the front, suddenly turned over her whole body facing him, continuing to walk backwards proficiently, even though turned towards Fei.

“Also, there seems to be a different shower and bathroom for both it seems. I still remember the case where I, by mistake entered those ones especially meant for the gents and the ones present there got in a panic regarding it. Why was it so?”

“Well… Because it would be really awkward and unpleasant if they were to be the same for both.”

“What would be so awkward and unpleasant?”

“…………”

Well first of all, there is no concept of gender in the cognizance of Gods.

Even though she looks like a really cute and adorable girl, she might really have a hard time to comprehend the subtleties of human perceptions of s*x and gender without a doubt.

…… Or so I was thinking… though

…… This girl, she definitely understands it and still asked didn’t she.

Why do I think that is so?

That is very much because of this girl, whose face appeared grinning and her flame like vermillion hair wavering in the movements of air.

She completely looks like someone who is having fun looking at the person who is having a hard time on how to exactly answer that said question to her.

“Ne~ ne~ what is so troublesome about that~. I really want you to tell me~.”

“You’re asking me, despite absolutely understanding the complete reason behind it. YOU SICK-PERVERTED-OLD GOD……. LOOK FORWARD AND WALK. ELSE YOU WILL COLLIDE!”

“I won’t collide due to just this.”

“Aren’t you asking me that you despite understanding the complete reason behind it. YOU SICK-PERVERTED-OLD GOD……. LOOK FORWARD AND WALK. ELSE YOU WILL COLLIDE!”

“I won’t collide due to this.”

As she tells that, she dodges a female apostle easily, even though not looking at her back.

“Ehm?”

“Than emphasizing on your victory, let’s hurry for now. We have to stop Pearl before it’s too late.”

They went up the stairs to the second floor, where at the end of the hallways lay the private room of Pearl.

and…

 

Rang the intercom.

But despite how long they waited, there seems to be no reply whatsoever.

Is she even here? or perhaps already…

“Hey Fei, the door seems to be unlocked.”

“Eh, the door is not key-locked?”

Reche proceeds to push the door open (with her hand).

The door, making a crackling sound, begins to open up slightly and slowly.

It was not locked at all.

What passed through the mind of Fei were the previous words speaking of retirement from the very mouth of Pearl.

“You don’t mean that you (went to give your retirement letter) after cleaning up the room!? Hey, Pearl!”

[TL Note: most probably speaking out loud, although Pearl is not present there. Kind of a soliloquy.]

“Did we not make it in time? Did our thoughts not grasp that as also a possibility?”

It might also be very likely that she got out of the Mystic Court (dormitories) by yesterday itself.

“Pearl, it’s me, are you still here?”

[TL: the last words spoke as: are you not here? ; I apologize for changing it a bit accordingly, well I did change many previously too. ugh.]

We infiltrated into her room.

We proceeded through the narrow doorway and started our way into its hall.

We kicked open the door which connected to the living room.

And what we found was…

A girl who just coincidentally looked back as the door opened.

“Aaah my goodness, you are still here. Tte… arre…?”

“……Wa-wa-wa-awa-wa”

Well, Pearl was there.

But…,

It seems she was in the middle of changing her clothes.

So, she was basically HALF-NAKED with only her lower underwear still put on.

And moreover,

it seems, Pearl was in the faction of those who looked ‘trim after wearing clothes’.

The bulge of those chests which were slightly pinkish on the color scale, was tried really hard by Pearl to hide with her two small hands. But unfortunately, keeping aside that she was failing to hide it miserably, the bountiful bulge was so plump that it was as if they were on the verge of spilling out her palms.

Rather, doesn’t it look like it grew into two wonderfully ripe fruits~. [TL: ready to be feasted~ xD]

“…… WHAT DID YOU WANT TO SAY!?”

even though she said that,

the eyes of Reche….

was gawking through at her, wide open.

Huge…

Yesterday, while she was still wearing the designated clothes of the Mystic court, a thought of ‘perhaps’ did cross my mind.

What a wonderful growth she possessed with such a gentle and timid personality.

“…… you can’t be serious.”

Reshe suddenly fell down to her knees.

Yes…

While comparing, Pearl’s overwhelming prideful ‘body’ with her possessed b*****s.

[TL: She lost it.]

“B—Big… It’s big. It’s just too big……. So.. so this is where it all ends… inside that gap created by those b*****s, everything… everything would get swallowed without any discrimination!”

“WHAT THE HECK ARE YOU COMMENTING ON MY B*****S!?”

“GIBBBB MEEEEE HAAAALLLLLFFFFF OOOFFF TTTTHHHHOOOSSSEE FAAATTTT!!!”

“KYAAAAAAAA——————-!?”

Pearl’s loud screams were heard as Reche grabbed her b*****s tightly with her eyes blood-filled.

……………

A few moments later…

“…… I usually don’t open the door so as to speak. Because, I can easily skip through the entrance door with the spell of teleportation.”


 

Chapter 3.8

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

In the living room, Pearl was now changed into normal plain clothes, said so, opening her mouth slowly.

“I always thought it was locked and didn’t even mind checking it. To think it was unlocked this whole time……”

“You mean to say that it was kept unlocked long before we came here too?”

“…… for about 6 months”

For about half a year, she had her entrance door unlocked… It is rather more surprising to think that she was able to stay safe until all this time.

“and, well because of that…… you were able to see quite a few things right? My…… various things……”.

“No, that is……”

Just by remembering those, Fei’s face turned hot.

The Pearl in her normal clothes looked just like any normal gentle and timid girl, who would have thought that underneath she was hiding such dangerous explosives.

[TL: the original read more like: underneath she was hiding such a tempting and exciting body.]

“…… Sorry.”

“Nope! Even from my end. Rather, it was my fault to keep the door unlocked to begin with!”

Pearl’s face reddened as she waved her hand in denial.

“Ah. But you will have to take responsibility and make me happy for the rest of my life ok,”

“WHY SUCH HEAVY RESPONSIBILITY FOR THAT!?”

“Just kidding~”

Pearl’s expression at long last seemed to soften up.

But that was only short lived,

almost immediately while exhaling deeply from those lovely lips.

“I am also one of those participants who had their debut last year. When I heard about the great success of Fei-san right after his debut, I became extremely moved. That too, enough to start admiring him.”

“…………”

“That is the very reason I feel like a mismatch. Fei sama and Reche sama are truly awesome, and then if I become a part of their team, (I think,) I might just extend to someone who would just drag your legs down……”

She weakly turns her neck sideways.

What Pearl was looking at now, was the corner of the living space. The room was cleaned off because she was planning to leave,

while there was a single large paper bag lined up around the corner.

“Ah that? I was planning to exit from being an Apostle, so I went forward to my previous team members with sweets in order to apologize.”

The team which lost because of my fault. “The Blaze of Light”.

In which some of them had their third and final loss, getting retired from being an apostle.

It was the very incident which made Pearl decide to stop being an Apostle altogether.

On the other hand, what caught Fei was the “what happened after you went to apologize? Um, I think it is quite hard to ask but, is there a lot of sweets yet left in there?”.

“……They didn’t even accept any of it.”

The blonde-haired girl continued staring down weakly.

“The captain was somewhere out, thus not there. But my teammates said that I was not even qualified to have a meeting with him in the first place. …… ah ahahaha. Isn’t that right? Even if I go there, it will only make them remember unpleasant memories.”

That is why I returned back while carrying these paper boxes in my hand.

What should I even do with these sweets now. I am at a complete loss (not knowing what to do with these).

 “The only thing I can do is swifty……”

 

“DOOONNN’TTT!!!”

Reche howled.

Without saying that she got bored to just continuously sit down, She stood up, pointing at that blonde girl.

“You introduced yourself as Pearl didn’t you!”

“YE, YES!?”

 

“I am left astonished… not only you, but even your teammates, you all can’t even understand what games are in actuality. And this too is because of the same reason.”

Reche goes to the room corner and opens up the paper bag lying in there.

She stared at those sweet boxes and commented…

“You don’t need such candies or sweets for making the other party happy. Even if you lose or manage to secure a win; the ultimate is that you were able to have fun. That is — what game is, don’t you think?.”

“That—That is…”

 

“In the “Play of Gods” the victor being Gods themselves is obvious to begin with. Letting one person bear the whole cause of loss is despicable.”

“…… I—I am happy that you say such a thing but.”

Pearl bites her lips

While clenching her fists weakly, she looked at the roof, thinking about something..

“but—BUT! I AM JUST good for nothing… desu…”

“Are you capable of replying?”

[TL note: It is perhaps telling her, they won’t listen to of her replies whatsoever]

While sitting on the sofa, Fei continued on from the words where Reche stopped.

“The faults in playing the game will be compensated with only a game. That team was called “The Blaze of Light” am I correct? The next time we go to play the “Play of Gods” why not just let us go there together?”

“Just play an active part over then and it will all be good.”

“I-It’s impossible!? That—that I alone would never…”

“That is why I am asking, let’s do it altogether.”

“Wha?!”

Pearl… This time lost all words in her mouth.

This was not due to any despair of sorts..

But rather, it was because for the first time, she felt a bit hesitant about that resolve to retire, she had built until now.

“With our group of three, we will help the members of your previous team. If that were the scenario, you would be able to right?”

“……bu, but……”

“To be honest, I don’t feel any sort of pity for your previous team whatsoever. As Reche said, the “Play of Gods” is so difficult that it is normal to be on the losing end to begin with. But the reason I am obsessed with the game is different. It is because of the reason that, ending the game while being in the losing end is incredibly frustrating. That is why.”

Pearl Diamond: 1 win ; 1 loss

Even though she tasted a crushing defeat, in the end it remains as the only defeat.

She still has the right to retaliate, remaining. The very retaliation of challenging God to games; that is.

“…………”

“For this time only, come along with me. I will not ask you ever again after this.”

“…… MOU~.”

The blonde-haired girl softly chuckled and smiled.

After putting away the small forming teardrop to the bottom of her eyelid with her slender fingertip.

“For me, receiving such a passionate recruitment is my very first time…….”

“It works both ways actually. We are also searching for people ourselves, thus think of it as a mutual give and take.”

“…… Thank you very much. Then it will be for the very last time again.”

The girl with the ability of spatial transition deeply bowed down her head towards them.

“Apostle Pearl Diamond. I will be thankfully joining your team then.”

5

The Way of Winning the ‘Play of Gods’.

In the Ruin Branch of the Mystic Court, they have the 5 Colossal statues that serve as the entrance to the stage of “Play of Gods”.

Those colossal statues, which resembled the head of a dragon, the opening of the entrances is all up to the mood of Gods themselves.

Sometimes there are those entrances which open just after the finishing of one game, while there are also those entrances which do not open even after a long time of 10 years going by.

When the entrance opens up, the gateway from that colossal statue serves as a signal that God is telling “Let’s Play a game”.

And then, the Mystic court recruits a participating team for that event.

…..

…..

Kotsu.. kotsu..

With the sound of each step reverberating, Fei, accompanied by Reche, were walking along the corridor.

Behind them is also the figure of the person known as one of the space-transition ability user-girl, called Pearl.

“I think Pearl is unneeded to be told, but I will just say/explain it once again for Reche, just because the entrance of the colossal gate has opened up, it doesn’t mean that every team will try to put forth their names in the participating event. There are times when the team members of that particular team have caught a cold, or even the possibility of a possible vacancy in that team.”

“Even I know that much too. The moment there is an entrance opened up, there will be members who will put forth their names to join in that event right?”

While walking on the 7th floor hallway, Reche pointed towards a large wall-mounted monitor.

Chapter 3.9

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

“The head manager also told me about it, that it was not only the apostles who were in an uproar over the opening of the statue’s doors, but also the Mystic Court’s administration too, having a hard time preparing for the live broadcast for the same.”

“Well, yeah. I heard that our battle against the God Titan also had a TRP rating too.”

The “Play of the Gods” is being broadcasted and watched from all over the world.

Incidentally, when Fei was being chased around by those Gods, here in the real world, the popular host’s live commentary was keeping the audience excited and in a frenzy.

The sudden participation of the returned famous newcomer, known as the best rookie in the world, Fei, and the Dragon God Leo Reche.

There is no way they won’t get excited over this.

“I have heard it in rumours also though, but it is not only in this city but rather the whole world has their eyes fixed on us. — And so, I have come here to request this out of you.”

“If that were so, wouldn’t it be better to wait for my reply and then open the door, Fei-kun?”

On the other side of the door that Fei opened, was Miranda tapping the keys of the electronic terminal on her desk.

She sighed,

“Fuuuuu”

“My business was what has been written in the message I sent you a while ago, did you read it?”

“Hai , Hai, Maa, take a seat Fei-kun, Reche-sama and ……”

Looking through those thin lenses, what the head manager was looking towards was this blonde-haired girl sitting next to Fei.

“Apostle Pearl Diamond-san eh”

“Ye, YES……!”

“Spatial skill users are really indispensable, so I thought you would be joining any other team by now anyway. But to think that you ended up being picked up by Fei.”

The head manager stood up and gave off a bittersweet smile.

“So then~, Fei-kun’s concern or business was to get informed when her previous team “The Blazing Light” has presented their application for enrolling into the next capture of the “Play of Gods” right.”

“Yeah, something like that.”

“I will just say it beforehand though, that’s a violation of the rules you know…?”

Obviously, I know…

“Teams need mutual consent and understanding between each other to work together. And, even if I were to ask the Mystic Court unilaterally, “I want to know the movement of other teams” like this time, they will not even bother to answer you back.”

“It’s the ability, the performance, the track record, that is held supreme in apprehending an apostle. The more you win the “Play of Gods”, the more preferential treatment you get from the Mystic court. The popularity from the citizens too will also rise.”

Saying this, the head manager takes off those spare glasses she was wearing and puts those in between her fingers, starting to twirl them proficiently.

“And then there are these people who try to pull others’ legs. This in itself becomes another problem altogether, you can understand too, right?”

To challenge the “Play of God” and lose it purposefully.”

“Not only that, but there are also some people who dare to stand around so that God has an advantage, defeating popular apostles and kicking them down from posing any rival to their teams.”

Such deals do take place in dark-black market, with exorbitant prices on stake.

“That is the very reason why the schedule of the respective team capture (for “Play of Gods”) participation is limited to the teams who are able to trust each other.”

“You can conduct an altogether practice of the “Play of the gods” together between the teams, play against each other, interact and then deepen your friendships accordingly. After that, then you can ask each other for that information. From the point of view being the Head Manager, I can’t tell you about that sensitive information you know? Or so I am in the position at present to not to.”

“We are not the side to pull others’ legs down, but rather are the side to push them forwards, so that is that.”

“……fumu”

Head Manager Miranda sighs hard.

Even now, she looks at the face of Pearl, who is about to cry herself out and gives off a wry smile.

“Well, whatever, if you both were going to participate, it’s likely that the ratings (perhaps the TRP) would go on a positive hike. So, I’ll just tell you what you want to know~.”

She said so in a good mood.

While she continued to play with her spare spectacles around her fingers, she said “But in contrast, you will DEFINITELY have to win, OKAY~ Mr. Fei-kun~?”

6

A few Days Later—–,

Resting place of the Colossal Statues

Commonly known as the

“Dive Centre”.

In front of the colossal statues having at least a 20(, rather more,) of those recording devices with approximately, a number of 22 apostles were in standby.

Pearl’s previous team, “Blazing Light”, having 19 members

With Fei, Dragon God Reche, and Pearl; these three members.

The preparations for the on screen deployment of the “Play of God” through the God-eye lens will be ready shortly. The wait time on proceeding to the capture is t-30 minutes.

“FE—FEI-SAAAA–AN!!! I-I THINK I–ITS IMPOSSIBLE! I CANNOT DO IT!?”

“you’re exaggerating~… you are just gathering some attention thats-“

“THEY ARE OBVIOUSLY STARRING DAGGERS AT MEEEEEE…. AAAHHHHHH!?”

Getting those stares from the former team members, the face of Pearl was now turning bright blue-black fast.

The live broadcast which was previously waited upon had now started rolling, due to the whole world now witnessing the incidents real time, there was no ranting whatsoever currently going on, but, the stares coming from the regions from where the camera is unable to record from was putting a lot of stress and pain on Pearl.

“Ah, it’s Miranda~”

“Good morning, Reche sama”

The one who appeared from inside the elevator was the Head Manager Miranda.

After secretly glancing over at the viewer count of the live broadcast displayed on the front screen, she continues…

“WOW, before the game even started, the number of viewers had already crossed Eighty-nine million. That is some outrageous level of attention you are getting aren’t you~”

“As expected of the first official challenge of Fei-kun and Leo-Reche together~ Though the subject of talk is not actually applicable here…”

“Oh right! Since during the game with that Titan God we participated suddenly.”

“Un. That time also we got a high audience count too. But this time it is your two official first games together, your(s) First Stage.”

Head manager voices her voice in a playful and good mood.

“By the way Pearl-kun, as you know, the game is being broadcast live and being watched by people all around the world. All the Best~.”

“ah…, awa-wa-wa-wa!?”

“Well, just play naturally and you will be all okay~. This is just a game~.”

Fei hit her shoulders which were shivering verily.

When the blonde-haired girl looked back towards him, Fei once more slapped those shoulders hard,

“I will repay the debt I owe. To the former team, with the best victory as the present.”

“…… Ye, YES!”

“It is time now.”

As soon as head manager Miranda said those words, the apostles and cameramen present came to their formation all at once.

The mouth of that colossal statue of the dragon head —- started to shine, and almost immediately, a door of light was seen formed beyond; inside it.

“Now then, let’s go.”

The one who said those words was the captain of Pearl’s previous team, “Blazing Light”. As soon as he tells, his teammates, subordinates, continue to go inside that opened door through that Dragon mouth.

So then, what’s next——-

What God is awaiting me, with what type of game in his domain.

While thinking on those lines.

Chapter 4.1

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

 

Chapter 4: The Game v/s The God of Infinite – Ouroboros; The Forbidden Word

“The Play of Gods” initiated by the superior Gods even among the Gods.

Humans who become chosen by the Gods become apostles, which enables them to travel to and fro the spiritual higher realms, to the “The Playground of Gods”.

There, what space awaits them? And which God will they be competing against. It is only the Gods who know the answer.

And……

The place where Fei and the others came to, didn’t have anything but a wide-spread sky.

A vivid Gradation of Blue

Where the sky seemed to continue till the horizon, below them were the sea of pure-white patches clouds.

The upper-half was the continuous deep-blue sky. The lower half was the continuous sea of clouds.

The total of twenty-two apostles, including Fei, continued to freefall hundreds of meters into the sea of clouds that filled the world below.

“Wha!? What the Heck is Thiiisss!!!!!!!?????”

Amidst the roaring wind, Pearl screamed at the top of her voice.

“aren’t we just continuing to fall! Is it something like, if we are unable to fly, we will be deemed disqualified. Reche san, can’t anything be done to this!?”

“N-…… it’s not like I won’t be able to fly up to the skies or anything like that though”

Reche, who was moments prior, falling on her back, was now held by arms folded around her.

But even while being clung upon by Pearl in mid-air, The ex-kami sama girl was as relaxed/unfazed as always.

“Why don’t we just continue falling till the point we are still curious about it? If we fall tens of thousands of meters like this, and then encounter a ground in the end.” “We will be squashed flat as we land on the ground!”

“But, I will be fine.”

“EVERYONE BESIDES YOU WILL GET COMPLETELY WIPED OUT OH GOD!!!”

And… they continue to fall down the sky… with only a sea of clouds seeming to open up as they continue falling though……

And as Fei continues watching at the spreading white sea of clouds, he encounters an anomaly which seemed to unfold.

 *sfx Lightening

A sound heard reverberated as if the air had just suddenly burst out open, following which the sea of clouds burst open revealing us to that huge ocean which is as vast as the sea of clouds itself. Just like a hot huge and thick, bulgy cotton-candy like cloud was now a big hole spreading open—- and in the depths of which, there is seen a black shadow slithering and shimmering.

“……”there’s something under the sea of clouds!”

Coming towards the surface. Something incredibly huge ─────────

An unbelievable huge dragon comes and breaks open through the sea of clouds.

“What the h**l is that?

It’s bizarrely, unusually huge.

 

It was so huge that Fei, who was freefalling from a high altitude, couldn’t see the whole thing even if he looked down. The dragon, bathed in the light of the sun had its whole body shining with deep purple color through its scales.

 

Bigger than elephants, even the whales—

More than even that Titan God itself—

It was way bigger than any God I’ve ever seen till now.

 “No way. ……”

 “That is!?”

Fei’s words were followed by an apostle who was also falling through the air. Pearl’s former teammates, the nineteen members of the “Flaming Light”.

All of them were looking down at the giant dragon below them with pale faces.

“Are you kidding me, in such an important time,……”

“It’s Ouroboros!”

After that scream, everyone, including Fei started having cold sweats running down the spine.

*sfx shudder

 

The moment he saw the “god”, his spine shuddered in fear. There was no logic or reason to it. Just the mere fact that it exists was enough to make a person tremble in awe. It was such an existence —-

…… This is the first time for me too.

…… In comparison to the Gods, I have met so far, this one breaks all those preconceived conventions! I can’t just stop shivering.

“This is that Ouroboros. ……!”

The God of Infinite Ouroboros.

Capture success even now remains 0%. No matter who it was in the past. Be it the saint, the superhuman, even that genius of playing games known to the entire humankind. All were defeated equally, just like a newborn baby. The God of Despair against whom no one had ever succeeded ever in history.

If you come in contact with this God, are drawn to a game with this God. There is no possible option other than losing. It is such an overwhelming hurdle that even the mystic court would suggest “surrender” before even thinking of playing a game against it for real. That is for, due to this humongously big black dragon.

“…… So we get to have a match against him at this point of time. Let’s get ready for this.”

Forgetting how to blink; Fei focused his eyes, staring towards that.

Down…down…down… we, being led by that God of Infinite, Ouroboros; continue falling down the sea of clouds where that swims.

“I will challenge you, (your) God’s Game!”

── Playground of the Gods “The wide Sky-space of Zero” VS “The Infinite Growth Potential” Uroboros’ game, start.

Chapter 4.2

 

Translated BY: Darkapta

 

 

2

Infinite God Ouroboros.

 

Ten kilometers long…

If you consider the fact that before this God appeared, the maximum length God the human apostles had ever face was about six hundred meters, one is forced to imagine how out of the ordinary this becomes.

 

In terms of sheer size only, there are two different digits expressing its hugeness.

 

Add to the fact, that the level of this God game is rated to be: unconquerable.

In the past, teams had been over a hundred people who got “chosen” by this God and were completely annihilated. None of them could even find a clue on how to conquer, Less conquer the game itself.

“Ahhhhhh It’s all over!?”

Pearl’s scream echoed throughout the infinitely wide blue sky.

“I’ve run out of all ideas.…Oh, also thank you for inviting someone such as me to this God game. Fei san, Reche san . And sorry.”

“Aren’t you too early in giving up?”

“But I mean! Just look at who is under us!”

Twenty-two people falling down the sea of clouds.

The very beneath was the huge earth ── no.

The back of Ouroboros, which spread about vastly across the sea of clouds like a huge playground.

“I’m so glad, at least there’s a proper place for landing.”

“Aren’t you mistaking it for a crash site!? We, the moment we are able to land on the back of that Ouroboros, we will be annihilated completely without even a trace remaining I tell you!”

“The Distance before landing was about seven hundred meters.”

It is indeed taller than a hundred-story skyscraper, but, well to say about what can or would happen the person who would try to come down by jumping off the roof is needless, nonetheless.

“…… I’ll probably be able to do something about it (handle it). Well, I will lose consciousness thought.”

Fei’s blessing/curse was: The one who is an object of the supreme affection of Gods”

[Tl note: Am I the only one feeling Re:zero vibes?]

This power, which is classified under the superhuman category, makes “Fei Regenerate” continuously as witnessed in the battle game against the Titan God. From abrasions to fatal wounds, its recovery potential is endless.

…… I would become a flattened mess though.

…… But, in a matter of a few seconds, I will be conscious once again. Although it will be really insightful and disgusting.

Reche… I guess she wouldn’t even have a scratch on her without a doubt.

In other words, the only problem is this person.

“Can’t you do something about yourself, Pearl? With that space transition of yours?”

“Ah, my space transition spell works with a maximum distance of about thirty meters …… Also, it is not a height that I can manage even if I were to reduce my falling distance by thirty meters!”

Understood. If this were a building, thirty meters tall, it can transfer a definite space from the roof to the ground and vice versa.

But in a free fall of several hundred meters, even if the distance shrinks by about thirty meters, I mean that the result of the crash won’t even differ in the slightest.

“More than that, what about FEI san!?”

“I’ll probably be fine. I think.”

“Oh!? That means, even I will be saved, is it!”

“────────”

“WHY ARE YOU TURNING AWAY YOUR EYES!?”

“Caught you.”

At that very moment, Reche grabbed the collar of this troubled Pearl.

“Really, Human bodies are so brittle, you know.”

“…… Reche san!”

“Didn’t I tell you that I can do something as simple as fly in the air, didn’t I?”

While falling, she dexterously carried Pearl on her small back, and proceeded to extend her small hands here as well.

“Here, Fei too.”

“Can something be done about this?”

[TL note: about the free fall I guess.]

“In short, it will be alright if you all were to fall slowly right?”

The falling speed started decreasing.

Fei’s felt that he was being supported by invisible hands from under his feet.

“Telekinesis?”

“Un. Isn’t it a common blessing/curse among those given by the Gods too~”

Slowly, as if the hot air balloon would lower its altitude. Fei and his teammates continue on to land on the back of this Giant God. On its scales, which were at least as hard as steel.

“…… I don’t feel like I am still alive.”

Pearl sat down flat on the ground as if her legs gave out.

Near her was Fei standing tall, while Reche looked pleasantly at the sea of clouds below them.

“Hey, Fei, don’t you think too that this empty space continues infinitely.”

“I’m rather surprised that there exists a God as huge as this.”

“Ouroboros, the God of Infinite.”

Measuring from the head to its tail, it will amount to ten kilometers. This is the actual measurement given by an apostle who challenged it in the past. While again, the width of the back alone amounts to somewhere around three hundred meters.

It’s a size where you can conduct a footrace competition easily.

…… It’s so big that it appears no different than standing on the ground-stadium.

…… It doesn’t even feel like I’m riding on the back of a God to begin with.

Perhaps it’s because of God Ouroboros not moving or drifting on the sky, it appears no different than standing on the ground, earth itself.

 “…… Um, Fei-san?”

A frightened (cat), Pearl stood up.

Like Leche, looking down on the sea of clouds from the back of Ouroboros.

“Weren’t we successfully able to land on top of God’s back? Does this mean that we were able to successfully capture all our objectives in this game……”

“I was also wondering about the same thing here.”

A successful landing from the altitude of seven hundred meters is difficult, but not impossible.

If it is a superhuman type spell such as of telekinetic power, or even a magician type spell as Leche showed us, they will be able to make it as well, by loosening the falling speed with the magic spell of the wind.

“I think it’s still too early. If you compare this situation to that of the card game, for example, poker—“

“Is it like when you distribute cards to the participating people?”

“It is the moment one enters the hall of the match itself.”

“Doesn’t that mean that the game has not even begun in the first place!?”


 

Chapter 4.3

 

Translated By Darkapta

 

 

“Maybe that’s the point in itself. If it were about the other Gods, there’s a lot of information present in the database of Mystic court as well, but, Ouroboros is riddled with mysteries from the very start to end. So, For the start, I will exchange information.”

“Huh? with whom?”

“From them, over there.”

Fei pointed towards the faces of the team “Light of the Flame Blossom” who landed behind at a distance of about a hundred meters to them. Some people were crouched due to getting injuries during their descent.

“To the members of “The Light of the Blazing Fire”!? Eh? Eh? Bu… But we are in no position to do that in… any……”

“I will be going up front, so it will be alright.”

“I and Fei would be the only ones talking so no worries.”

Fei at the front. Followed was Reche, and then Pearl – who was walking timidly in fear. Proceeding forwards, on top of this giant glistening scales.

“Excuse me, may I have your attention. Thank you. I am Fei. Following me, she is Reche.”

“…………”

There was astonishment, as they glanced around.

The former colleagues of the apostle Pearl looked at her. They didn’t look hostile. But their sight was clearly not that of someone which can be mistaken for friendly.

“Since I was not even able to give my greetings earlier. But well, since we are going to be working together on this, let’s give it our all.”

“It’s that last year’s newcomer Fei Theophilus and that Dragon God Leo Reche sama. They’re the hot topic in the entire branch right now. From our point of view, co-operation with you is something we couldn’t ever dream of declining.”

Facing towards his back, in front of those dozens of subordinates before him—

The man of the rank of a captain with his back still turned towards his subordinates, with a side look from his face.

Let out a solemn sigh.

“……It’s been a while hasn’t it?”

“I’m very sorry!!!!!!”

“Now, now. She has her own role to play. We invited her, so please be easy on her.”

Taking the place of Pearl, who hid behind Reche. Fei waved his hand in front of him.

…… Oh, so by captain, you meant this guy?

…… So he was the person who got lumped together with Pearl when she activated the phase exchange and as a result of which, he was trampled flat by the God.

However, the surprise for Fei was that the captain himself remained to the extent of having a bitter face, compared to his subordinates who did not even try hiding their displeasure.

…… Maybe the captain himself has more or less accepted the fact that what was done is done.

…So, it was actually the subordinates who were unable to forgive Pearl yet eh?

She seems to be hated even now.

That day must have had quite a fiery atmosphere without a doubt.

“Excuse me. uh, Captain Ovan?”

“It’s Ovan Misketz. The fourth captain of the team “Light of the Flame Blossom”. This will be my third year.”

His age would perhaps be somewhere around 30 yrs.

He has chiseled facial features accompanied with a severe-strict look. Perhaps, amongst the apostles who range from their twenties to their thirties, it can be said that he is a veteran who is the oldest and most experienced here among them.

Such a captain, and the subordinates surrounding him.

And—-

Their total numbers don’t match up…?

There should have been nineteen people apart from the captain participating from “Light of the Flame Blossom”. But, even after taking the captain into account, their numbers don’t seem to exceed even fifteen.

“Our Four people have been eliminated”

Before Fei could proceed in asking about them, the captain sighed and replied.

“Free fall from an altitude of seven hundred meters. There were only five apostles who could withstand that, including me. With those five at hand, saving fifteen was our limit.…… As a result, three people were dropped out and returned to the real world, being unable to withstand the crash.”

“That’s three of you, who’s the other one?”

“──── It’s them.”

What Ovan pointed towards was the very sea of clouds below them. As we stared at the clouds, something appeared out of the blue hiding in between the clouds, for a moment.

It had a silvery skin which seemed to melt into the color of this sea of clouds.

It looked like a snake, but its body also had small limbs that seemed to have degenerated.

“What is that flying whale!?”

Pearl’s voice trailed off.

A pure white whale swimming in the sky.

The tail and pectoral fins are as big as airplanes, and they were swimming in the sky with ease.

 

The God was not the only one swimming on this sea of clouds. There were hundreds of these giant monsters following God and its orders around.

“In the Mystic Court, we call them the Sky Whales. They’re small compared to this God, but they’re more than ten meters long, so they’re monstrous enough. They wait for an apostle to fall off the back of a God.”

“So that means… don’t tell me. ……”

The moment their prey falls, they transform from whales into ferocious piranhas. Even if one of them fell out of position rather actually fell into the sea of clouds, and …… well we can guess the rest.

The captain shook his head feebly.

“Thus our 4 members have been eliminated. The rest remaining are the fifteen of us here. Anything else?”

“…… No, it’s okay.”

 

The expressions reflected by the members of the “Light of the Flame Blossom” were so dark that even Fei’s decided to resist from asking any more about it.

They were close to losing their will to participate in war.

“……It’s impossible. We’re up against “that” Ouroboros.”

The man of the subordinate muttered.

After surviving the trial of falling from an altitude of several hundred meters, and with a voice which doesn’t have any enthusiasm of being able to or qualified to play the real game, in such a scornful voice.

“It’s the worst. Out of all things, this…”

“We’ve already lost two more times, and if we lose one more time, we’ll have to forcefully retire, so I thought I’d try my best to not regret later. But……Why is it, why did we end up here…..!”

Even a girl starts shedding tears.

Chapter 4.4

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

Ouroboros is considered the worst God. With even the headquarters of the Mystic Court allowing its apostles to consider “Surrender Unconditionally”.

They don’t even mind if you happen to give up before starting.

Even if every apostle does indeed exit from this game, the audience also doesn’t blame them for doing so.

Ouroboros is such a devastating opponent.

“……Everyone, raise your faces!”

To get the attention of those heart-lost subordinates, Captain Ovan clapped his hands to inspire them.

Don’t forget that this is being broadcasted. The whole world is watching our battle. …… The God is indeed tenacious, a vicious opponent, but first we must analyze the game.

“What do you want us to do ……?”

The subordinate said, biting his lip.

“What do you want me to do on the back of this ridiculously large God?”

Yes. The infinite God Ouroboros does not speak.

What kind of game is this?

“You’re a strange God. If you don’t even explain what kind of game we’ll be playing with you, but… does that mean that finding out the type of game is also a part of the game?”

Reche tilted her head curiously as her flame-colored hair fluttered in the air.

The sea of pure white clouds.

While comparing the whale in the sky, what can be seen is something hidden over a distance.

“The clue to this playground, isn’t it? Since they’ve prepared such a sea of clouds, the game should make full use of it. I’m also curious about those flying whales. What about Fei? What kind of game do you think this God would like to play with us?”

“I’m also thinking about the same thing.”

 

Fei sat down cross-legged on Ouroboros’ back.

While stroking the scales that were as hard as steel while also as smooth as glass.

At present even though I’m with Reche on this thought. This playground should serve as a clue. Since it was the same case with that Titan God.

The playground of the God changes it’s form depending on what type of game the Gods were going to play. Just as Titan prepared a group of buildings for playing “God-Pretend” with us – There is a high possibility that this infinite sea of ​​clouds itself is a device prepared by God.

“Wait!”

Captain Ovan intervened.

He looked at Fei and Leche in turn, as if puzzled.

“You guys don’t know? Didn’t you take a look at the database of Mystic Court?”

“Know what?”

We know how to play Ouroboros. One of the apostles who challenged it in the past was a psychic and spoke telekinetically.

He was successfully able to read the thoughts of this God.

I’ve been able to read only a few of them, but the game that I was somehow able to be understood was – Game Contents:

“The Forbidden Word”

[Victory Condition]

To make Ouroboros say “Ouch”

[Defeat Condition]

All participants must drop out

[Hidden Rule 1]

？？？？？？？

[Hidden Rule 2]

When you achieve Hidden Rule 1,

you can ■■ only for a certain amount of time.
 [TL note: read as: 一定時間のみ■■を■■できる]

“Forbidden word? What? But ……?”

Pearl blinked curiously, bending her head sideways.

“You mean, we have to make “this” God Ouroboros say, “It hurts”?

But wasn’t it the setting that this God cannot speak human language ……?”

“No, he cannot. By what we could understand up till now.”

On God’s back, which was about the size of a playground, Fei shook his head sideways in denial.

Some of the Gods do speak human languages, but they all have one thing in common.

That is: They all have a human form.

And this God was far less than that, moreover like a snake, a Dragon to be precise, no matter how you look at it.

I can’t even imagine him speaking a human language in the first place, also, I don’t think he ever will in the future as well.

“In the first place, Pearl, what do you think would happen if a God of such magnificence size screamed, “It Hurts!”.

 

“It will be …… noisy?”

There will be a shock wave with such a force and sound similar to that of being hit by a direct hit of a missile, in short, all of us riding on its back – will be shredded to pieces.

“Hiyah!?”

Thus, this means that even if we know the victory condition to be “It hurts”, this does not mean that it has the same meaning as its face value. It means one have to be creative and think of an alternative.

I turn my gaze towards the Apostles of the Flame Blossom (shortened).

And confronted their captain who still had a bitter expression plastered to his face.

“Or so I would determine it to be for now.”

“……that’s right. There is no record that this God had ever uttered human language before.”

The captain nodded reluctantly.

“It is also doubtful whether it is physically “painful” or not. Since, God is a spiritual being. Their sensory perceptions might not necessarily match with those of human senses.”

So, presently the problem lies on how to make the God say, “It hurts” and also manifest the victory conditions of acknowledging the said words of “It hurts”

There is no one who can explain though.

“Now I see. Even if we know the winning conditions, since no one has ever solved this game, thus it’s “winning conditions” is something no one knows how to achieve with respect to this God’s way.”

He put those into words, intending to let only himself hear it, Fei stood up on his feet again.

Pointing right towards Reche and Pearl.

“Well, it’s decided.do it, both of you.

“Yes? But what are you planning on doing?”

“I’m going to test every possibility thoroughly as it can be comprehended.”

In front of their questioning eyes, Fei raised his foot to his feet, the back of the God that was as vast as the earth.

“Let’s start with the basics of ‘ouch’!”

And swung his heel down at the scales beneath his feet.

However, “this” God’s back didn’t even bulge, not even as small as a thud sounded.

Moreover, it was Fei that made the scream.

“Arghh! It hurts!… my-my legs!… ugh its numb…”

“…… Um, what are you doing – self-destructing yourself?”

 

Jiiiii

Chapter 4.5

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

Pearl’s eyes were colder than any I could recollect having seen in the past.

Please explain.

“I thought that perhaps kicking it might even cause “this” God some pain. So I tried kicking it.

 

“How the heck would it even work!? You’re dealing with a God over here you know? Even if you step on it like that, it’s no less than an ant rampaging on an elephant’s back!”

“As I thought, Human force is a no good eh”

“AS. I. JUST. TOLD. YOU!”

“Then how about a power which is not human?”

“Eh?”

Pearl looked towards the direction Fei pointed his finger at.

There, fifteen apostles of Light of Flame Blossom gathered in one place and formed a circle. Magic spell by spell casters, and Telekinesis power by superhuman.

Both of them seem to be a type of power which might penetrate into the conscious “feelings of the Gods”.

“It seems the other side is also trying out the same principle. Well, if so many people fire all that once then… Pearl, at this place, we might as well get caught up with that and fall.”

“OH NO. PLEASE NO. H**L NO!?”

A pale-faced pearl jumps right into the transition gate and teleports immediately.

While at the same time,

KABOOM!

The sound of the air bursting up, and a gust of wind shockwaves hit Pearl’s entire whole body, she gets blown backwards.

“Kyaaaa!?”

“Oopsie, Pearl? Are you okay?”

Reche grabs hold of Pearl, who was about to fall from the pressure of the wind, saving and helping her to stay on spot.

Fei was also doing his best trying to stand firmly withstanding the shockwave.

“……As expected, you have quite some excellent apostles in your team.”

Once your capabilities reach a certain level, it is indeed a veteran team. Moreover, the timing of the magic activation was also just too perfect. It shows their daily training, the level of cooperation, how all of them are beautifully synchronized.

But.

“……I knew it!.”

Captain Ovan was speechless.

After the rising flame extinguished, the scales of Ouroboros appeared again, radiating it’s luster as it were. Leave alone a scratch, There was not even a speck of dust visible.

“It-it can’t be!? I shot at that with all my might!? And couldn’t even peel off a single scale……”

The face of all the apostles, who had formed a circle, turned pale one after another.

While looking at those lonely figure from a distance, Fei faced face-to-face towards Pearl.

“Humans are really powerless don’t you think?”

“DON’T ASK FOR MY CONSENT FOR SUCH A SAD THING!!”

“Pearl, what is your height?”

“Yes!? Ah well, it’s probably a hundred and fifty-six centimeters, but you can’t miss that I am still in my growth spurt. Since, as I measured myself last year, I had grown three millimeters long compared to the previous!”

“Ouroboros appears to be at least ten kilometers long… ten thousand meters long.”

“……?”

Pearl tilts her small neck like a cute little kitten.

It seems that my intentions were not conveyed properly.

“It’s the body length ratio I was talking about. How much do you think a human being two meters tall would appear to someone ten thousand-meter-long, Ouroboros?”

“Well……”

“Four hundred micrometers in human perspective. It’s a rough estimate though.”

“How big is that?”

“About the size of a large pollen.”

“Could you be more specific?”

“Mites, dust mites, house dust.”

“It’s getting worse!”

“It’d be easier to understand if I told you like this perhaps.”

While pacifying the pouting pearl, Fei pointed towards the back of God, rubbing his shoe to its scales.

“In short, this God doesn’t even know what is going on, on his back, including what we’re doing at present.”

There is a myriad of pollen and dust flying in the air – but humans don’t perceive it. For a God, human beings are perhaps something of a similar degree.

“Hey, hey, Fei. If that’s the case then~.”

Reche, who was holding her arms together, raised her hand up. She had an innocent smile, but a smile as if she thought of some special mischief altogether.

“Next is my turn! I’ll try too!”

Reche starts shaking hands, wielding her strong fists.

In front of Fei, Pearl, and all the other apostles of that “Light of Flame Blossom”.

“Hey, wait, wait, wait, wait, wait!? If you really go at it seriously, it’ll be seriously bad!”

“When you have an enemy so big, it’s well worth fighting with all you got don’t you also think too~”

“NO! NOT ABOUT THAT, WE’LL BE IN TROUB ──”

I wasn’t able to make it in time.

Faster than Fei could respond, or even Pearl able to escape through her transition gate in panic…

 *sfx lightening like sound

Reche’s tightened fist “exploded” on the back of the God Ouroboros.

The crushed atmosphere twisted and swirled like a tornado, the excessive force became a shockwave that blew the clouds in that sea of clouds away instantly.

“The Ouroboros?”

“It’s amazing… but isn’t it just a bit too much!!!”

“That” God’s back was now vibrating in reaction. Just as if it were the ripples of a big wave, Fei and his teammates standing on it started bouncing, as if on a trampoline.

“Help me, Fei-san!?”

“Pearl, hold on to those scales!”

Just to not get blown out down the surface, Fei and Pearl cling on to the scales with all they got. And while in that situation – .

“Aa……”

A member of the Light of Flame Blossom had his foot slipped.

In the process of helping/rescuing his companions, the other one fell from the back of God in his place. As the person fell headlong into the sea of clouds, he was caught hold by a flying whale who was waiting patiently for its prey to fall in due time.

And after some few seconds later.

The apostle-caught by that sky whale was bitten to death and now turned into light, returning to the real world.

One person dropped out.

And now, only fourteen remaining members of the Flame Blossom, Fei and the other three were left.

Chapter 4.6

 

Translated By: Darkapta

 

 

And after some few seconds later.

The apostle-caught by that sky whale was bitten to death and now turned into light, returning to the real world.

One person dropped out.

And now, only fourteen remaining members of the Flame Blossom, Fei and the other three were left.

“……………………”

The shaking eventually subsided.

All of the humans present there, including Fei and Pearl, were silently watching “that” Former Dragon God.

Half of them were watching in mere stupidity, while the other half in boiling anger.

“I-it’s not what you.”

While still trying to make her flame-colored hair flutter, Reche shook her head in denial.

“It’s not my fault, this is “Force Majeure”. It’s not my fault, this was an accident.

Don’t be fooled by this, it was all because of Ouroboros!”

“As expected, this was a man-made disaster right now.”

“It’s “that” God’s disaster!”

“Our fellow was……”

“Wha ……?”

It was Reche who raised her voice, as the people in the room stared at her.

“I’m sorry…….I’m the one at fault……”

“……Now, if it isn’t a direct apology from the Dragon God herself”

Captain Ovan made a big-big sigh.

He turned around to his men with a heavy air.

“I’m sorry for Nash who fell, but there was also an apology from Leo Reche. Remember guys, what we should be concerned about is this game’s capture.”

Captain Ovan.

It was then that Fei, not on the same team as that of the captain, raised his voice, rather than that man who was still glaring at her.

“As you can see yourself.”

“……What do you mean?”

“There was also a change in God’s atmosphere when Reche hit him full on. But there was no sign of a voice still coming out.”

“The Forbidden word” game, where one has to let “that” God say, “It hurts”.

“It would be impossible for an apostle if Reche, a former God herself, was unable to make him utter a single word, even after she hit it with full force. In other words, it can be concluded that it is not a game that would need raw physical power in order to make “that” God say “it hurts”.

“It is through and through a game of wits. What does it mean to make “The God say that it hurts”? In other words, God is telling us to use our heads.”

“Yes, you’re absolutely right, Fei!”


 Brushing away those protests aside, Reche restored her triumphant-energetic look.

“I also wanted to confirm that too. I wonder if you understood my motives everyone……Well, I accidentally forgot to adjust the amount of force though.”

“And, we were on the verge of annihilation because of that though!?”

“── Pearl. Reche, here~ over here~.”

Beckoning those two people who were about to make a fuss.

Fei pointed towards the far ends of the sea of clouds in front of Pearl and Reche.

“Towards the end of the back of this big God. Doesn’t it make you wonder, what might be going on?”

“It does!” “Are we going to walk till the edge of its back!?”

The voices of Reche and Pearl beautifully overlapped each other.

However, their reactions were polar opposite.

“Are we really going to walk till the edge of its back? S-since, the length of the path leading is enough to form a horizon. There may be more to come. ……”

“It’s ten kilometers long. If we consider that we were dropped in the middle, it’s only five kilometers walk from here to its head or tail. We can get there in an hour.”

“…… Oh. You’re right. if you think it that way, it surprisingly makes sense in a way.”

“Right?”

I started walking together with Pearl.

Well, In the end of this, we be coming back to its head, or the tail, whichever is unknown, Since we will be examining both eventually, neither actually matters anyway.

……You can go on till as long as you want. This game probably is not bound by a time system.

…… it will last-onn forever. Until our energy runs out and we surrender.

Two hundred and seventy-eight hours.

This is the amount of time that elapsed when one of the apostles surrendered after taking on the challenge by Ouroboros.

The reason why Fei remembers it, is because it was the “longest time it took for a single game” according to the records of the Mystic Court.

“Well, we’re in for a long haul, aren’t we?”

“Fei-san, look over there! The heavenly whales under Ouroboros have been following us all the time!”

Pearl pointed to the sea of clouds.

As we started moving towards the back of Ouroboros, the whales in the sky also started moving following our trajectory. Just like any carnivorous animal, eyeing their prey.

Well, since we’re the prey.

 

“I don’t taste good!”

 

Pearl, with tears rolling down her eyes, clung onto me with all her might.

 

She held onto Fei’s arm and just wasn’t letting it go. Well, that sort of problem didn’t matter in the first place. The problem that mattered was that: Pearl, in that very momentum, was unconsciously pressing her chests against him.

 

“Ah, um, Pe-Pearl ……?”

*sfx squeezing sounds

 

The beautifully matured pair of fruits, even though pressed quite strongly, yet felt incredibly soft even still. Feeling this incredible experience for the very first time, even the face of this inexperienced Fei involuntarily grew red hot.

 

“Pearl, calm down for a moment! You don’t have to be so scared about this, don’t you remember that you won’t be attacked till you are on Ouroboros’ back. The only time they will attack you is when you happen to fall.”

 

“But… BUT…”

 

She just doesn’t seem to separate herself yet.

 

Ah by the way, with regards to Reche

 

She was walking right beside me… although with a really really terrifying look on her face; I hope she didn’t notice that Pearl was clinging onto me this very moment.

 

Chapter 4.7

Translated By: Darkapta
 Edited by Hinagiku
 ———————————————–

Previously:
 The beautifully matured pair of fruits, even though pressed quite strongly, yet felt incredibly soft even still. Feeling this incredible experience for the very first time, even the face of this inexperienced Fei involuntarily grew red hot.

 

“Pearl, calm down for a moment! You don’t have to be so scared about this, don’t you remember that you won’t be attacked till you are on Ouroboros’ back. The only time they will attack you is when you happen to fall.”

 

“But… BUT…”

 

She just doesn’t seem to separate herself yet.

 

Ah by the way, with regards to Reche

 

She was walking right beside me… although with a really really terrifying look on her face; I hope she didn’t notice that Pearl was clinging onto me this very moment.

“uuuu I’m scared Fei san!, please don’t ever leave my side, absolutely!”

 

“Um, you know Pearl? There is something several hundred million times more frightening than those sky whales right to our back ……that, um, her bloodthirst ……”

“……Hmmmm”

Reche mutters.

It was a very dry voice, a voice devoid of any emotion.

“So, Fei is also like those types, aren’t you too?”

“……Like what?”

“Young men like girls with developed bodies, don’t they… In the age of ancient magic I know of, it is the same. Even the wisest of men in the kingdom proclaimed that a young maiden’s splendid chest has an appeal to even impede and surpass the magic of Gods.

 

“Is He really a wise man!?”

[Tl note: I concur… if he was a wise man, he wouldn’t say the truth out loud…]

“And even Pearl”

“kyaaan?”

Grabbing hold of the skin behind the neck of Pearl, Reche raised her up as if she were some cute little kittens.

“Weren’t you supposed to show your cool side to others?”

“Eh?”

“Towards those former teammates of yours, is it okay for you to show this cry-face of yours?”

Around ten meters away were the apostles of Light of Flame Blossom following up.

There are some who were exhausted, but also those who still had the spirit of challenge still alive in their eyes, including Captain Ovan.

“Didn’t you lose because of your own blunder before? If you were to be whining like this here also, wouldn’t they think, “Oh, so she’s still the same.”

“Well, that is……yes……”

Even though having a bewildered face, the girl bit her lower lips “It is just as Reche san says, ye-yes it is truly so! I cannot allow myself to be weak in a place such as this!”

“can you do your best?”

“I can do my best!”

“Can you run?”

“I can run! – huh? Run, where?”

“It’s up to the end of this. Well, it’s either the head or the tail though.”

With a big smile on her face, Reche grasped hold of the wrist of Pearl.

“Don’t you too want to see what is going on ahead quickly~, it’s just a waste of time to walk for so long.”

“Eh? Ah, actually I kind of wonder that I don’t actually care about that, that much or so……”

“So, without further ado, ready, get set~!.”

“Noooooo!?”

Pearl, being taken away by Reche, in a matter of seconds disappear to the further end of the sea of clouds.

“……Oi”

While basking under the strange look given by the team “Flower Blossom” from behind him, Fei could only sigh “Ahh well…” [yare yare]

“Are you guys, a team who can’t cooperate and work collectively with each other?”

Towards the Horizon of the clouds –-

Fei continued to walk endlessly on the back of God, which was so far beyond what the human eyes could see.

And when he came towards that end.

“Oh, it’s Fei there. Here~ over here!, this way!”

“I…I can’t……Run…anymore…… and didn’t we had to wait for Fei-san in the end. What was the point of sprinting all the way till here then……”

There appeared Reche waving towards them cheerfully, and the figure of Pearl, downright collapsed on the ground.

“Sorry to keep you waiting. So, is this the end?”

“Un. Hey Fei, look-look. It’s incredibly weird!”

Reche eyes lit up as she pointed towards her back.

The tail of this God.

The tail was bent at an almost right angle and extended straight up. From the perspective of Fei looking up, it looked like a huge wall.

 “And moreover, isn’t it quite fancy? It even has a huge thorn-like thorn growing from its tail.”

The Ouroboros’ entire body was covered in scales.

In addition to that, here in this tail there is a huge thorn poking out of it.

 

“Isn’t That’s nice~.”

“Don’t you think so too~?”

“Yeah. I can finally feel like we have reached the start-line of this game. Well that huge thorn also catches my attention but, moreover, the fact that the color of the tail-scale “over here” is silver, is absolutely awesome.”

Till now, the scales that Fei had walked on so far shone in a deep purple hue.

But only the scale on the tail is colored silver.

The more I look at it, the more I am allowed to think it means to say that “This is a place that’s meant to be special.”

…… I’m sure it’s a hint from the god.

…… For example, what are the chances that might conclude that this tail to likely it’s vital point?

Moreover, it has thorns growing about it.

The thorns, like those which grow on hedgehogs and roses, are in a way used as a self-defence, as if saying “don’t touch me.”

 “Recher, have you checked out this silvery tail yet? Like touching it, or climbing on it…”

Reche shook her head gently.

“No, not yet. I was kind of hesitant.”

“Since it’s way too suspicious.”

“……I’m also worried about the same over here. However, there is also the possibility that there is something to the back of the back door leading from it.”

“I GOT IT!!!”

While Fei and Reche were busy thinking with folded arms.

Pearl, who was supposed to have been lying down, completely exhausted due to that full sprint, jumped up with a loud and energetic voice.

“FEI-SAN!”

“Uwaaa, that surprised me! What is it now with you.”

“Fu. Fu. Fuu……”

As if the weakness from a while back were just a lie, Pearl drew towards him with huge steps. With a smile as if to indicate that she has understood the way to victory.

“I have discovered it at least. The way to defeat this undefeatable god!”

“……Discovered?”

“Let me enlighten you with the same. Now, focus your attention on this tail. Only here is covered with silvery scales, carefully even growing thorns out of it. How very suspicious!”

“……Ah Pearl… I kind of have a really bad feeling about this, so please hold down your tracks for a moment ─.”

“And! And!”

Fei’s voice of wisdom did not seem to reach her.

Chapter 4.8

 

Translated by: Darkapta
 Edited by: Hinagiku

 

 

While pointing at the towering tail extending straight at right angle, Pearl’s voice grew more passionate with every passing word.

“This is a game where you have to make this god say ‘it hurts’. If that’s the case, then this tail with different colored scales must be some sort of a vital point, and the spines are a check in order to keep the enemies away! What do you think?”

I can understand that.

Rather, Fei and Reche noticed that within two seconds when they looked at the tail, and furthermore, were able to adjoint some conclusions on what to do next as well.

…… But Pearl’s confidence in her conclusion is quite considerable.

…… Did she think of something at the same level of me and Reche, or did she go even beyond?

Gasping, Fei looked straight towards this blonde girl.

“Then tell us. This God Game’s capture method”

“Yes! That is……”

That is?

“To attack this tail! By striking this vital point, God will be definitely hurt and scream as it surrenders. Without a doubt!”

“……I see.”

Fei responds in a tired fashion, but Pearl who was completely euphoric in the magnificence of her own conclusion couldn’t even notice.


 

“What do you think, Miss Fei san, Reche san! This, my breakthrough of the century!”

“Pearl, I have a question.”

“Throw at me.”

“Perhaps, have you been told that your thoughts are a bit crazy or presumptuous?”

“Eh?”

Pearl’s eyes rounded up in puzzlement.

“How did you know that? I am often told so by my parents and my elder-sister.”

 “…… I see.”

“Also, the old ladies in the neighbourhood, the store clerk at the supermarket and the postman too. They often worry about me due to this. Really, isn’t it very rude? It’s very upsetting from my point of view.”

“Just how well known are you!?” [TL note: regarding this issue]

“When I was little, I was given the nickname as the ‘Fully Automatic Imagination-c*m-action Girl’. Really, don’t you think its very impolite?”

“Wow, how per–…… Nope, nothing.”

Ok… Now I get it.

When her mouth is shut, Her appearance looks like a quiet and gentle girl, but this Pearl is actually seemingly a type who believes in “Passion and Impetus to get the ball rolling”… more than this Reche over here.

 Now that I think about it…

When she was depressed because she thought she had no choice but to retire, she certainly had this glimpse of straightforward attitude.

“So, she’s the kind of person who can’t stop once she imagines something eh. Rather than me explaining it to her, Let’s just let her do it. ……”

“? Fei san?”

 “Ah, don’t mind me, I’m talking to myself. More than that, let’s adopt what you are thinking and put it into action.”

While waving his head and accepting her ideas, he inferred that.

The tail is covered in silvery shining scales around it.

“This may be the vital point of God. So, Pearl, go ahead and defeat this guy. We, me and Reche would be watching over you accomplish it.”

“Yes! Leave it to me!”

Pearl made a quick gesture of salute and turned around.

She looks up at the tail of Uroboros, towering like a silver wall, and holds her fist like a full-fledged fighter.

“Please witness it, Fei san, Reche san. The commemorative moment when this Pearl Diamond, sixteen years old, will defeat the undefeated god! It will perhaps be no exaggeration to say that this is the greatest feat in human history ever!”

“OH!, You can do It!”
 “Well Then!”

“Ah… that’s right, Pearl, just in case, an advice from me. The moment you hit it, run away from there immediately.”

“……yes?”

“It’s just in case. Well, just keep it at the back of your mind.”

And then ──

It was at that time when footsteps of many people came close. All the members of the Flame Blossom who followed Fei, had their faces turned blue.

“Captain Ovan! It is, after all!”

“They’re trying to attack the tail of God. What’s more, it’s a Pearl again!”

“Wait, Pearl!”

“Ah! Captain Ovan……”

Pearl turned around. He had been blatantly avoiding her from the moment he entered this space. Probably this was also even the first time that she was called by the captain, that she unknowingly became conscious about it.

“Captain Orban! Oh …… please overlook me.I think it’s at last the time for me to be able to atone for the mistake I made six months ago. With claiming victory over this God’s defeat!”

“STOP!?”

 “HOOYAH!”

The mental perception of these former teammates was somehow not on the same page.

Thinking that the tail was it’s undeniable weakness, it’s kryptonite, Pearl hit it with all her strength. A cute “pon” like sound sounded with that strike.

And not long after that ──

The tail of Ouroboros began to shine. Each silver scale starts to emit light like a big electric pulse, with it converging/accumulating into this huge thorn.

“…… Eh? Arre? What about the game clearing?”

“Ahh. So, it is as I thought, huh.”

As he backed away, Fei let out a deep breath.

“Pearl, how would you feel if you were to be suddenly hit on your head by someone?”

“? Obviously I would be angry. –“

“Then of course God would also be angry. And if you make the God angry, you might know what would happen following it ── ”

The light kept on gathering at the tip of God’s tail.

What does it mean?

“Pearl, you’d better bend down.”

“Reche held Pearl’s head and forced her on to the ground.”

God’s counterattack ──

Hundreds of rays of light shot out from Ouroboros’ tail.

The light indiscriminately burned down the apostles on its back, cut the sea of clouds into two, and even sliced up and burned up those sky-whales who were in its way.

And if ──

 

If these heat-light rays had been released in the real world, the walls protecting the human city would have melted like butter and collapsed down in half.

 

So what if humans were exposed to it?

“Are you all!?”

There was no way they could withstand it.”

In front of captain Ovan’s eyes, his subordinates who had been exposed to the divine rays disappeared without even screaming. They turned into light and were deported-summoned back to their real world one after the other.

Four were eliminated.

Chapter 4.9

 

Translated by: Darkapta
 Edited by: Hinagiku

 

 

Ten members remaining of Light of the Flame Blossom. With Fei and the others, another three remain.

“…Heh. W-why…… wasn’t this the capture method?”

 “It’s a trap.”

The voice of Captain Ovan, having a bruise on his cheek, said so while suppressing the weight/harshness in the tone of his voice.

Fortunately, the ray of light stopped till just just grazing the cheeks of the captain. But if it had been a direct hit, he would also have disappeared without a moment’s notice like his unlucky subordinates.

“Those who challenged the past tried it every time. The tail of Ouroboros is built in such a fashion as if to suggest humans to attack it. Although, the moment they touched it, they got completely annihilated by that Light Ray.”

“……I—it’s no—It’s different……Ah—I just—….”

With her body shaking, this shaken up Pearl said so with tears accumulating in the edge of her eyes.

“I didn’t have any wrong intentions. I… I thought that at last I will be able to be useful to everyone. Isn’t—isn’t it so, Fei san.”

“────”

“Fei san?”

“Now I understand. This tail does definitely have some special characteristics to it. If Ouroboros had deliberately built it in this way especially, then previous Light rays would have definitely been──”

“Is this the time to have such a serious face!”

I got scolded.

Pearl with raised eyebrows, got up almost as if jumped and barged in towards me.

“Fei san!”

“Wha—What is it… Even though, in just a moment of time, I could have discovered something really incredible.”

“Don’t tell me, did you realize that if someone touched this tail, there would have been a counterattack?”

“Un.”

“Whryyyyyy D I D Y O U N O T TELL ME ABOUT IT THAT! Thanks to you I──”

“Calm down Pearl.”

He holds on to the shoulders of this shaking girl with both his hands.

Peeking for a moment at that reddened face, Fei slowly opened his mouth.

“Even if you didn’t do it, I would have done it nevertheless.”

“It doesn’t make me feel COMFORTABLE in the least THOUGH!?”

“It’s an important verification. This is just my theory though, but there is no meaning to past data in the “Play of the Gods” whatsoever. The apostles in the past had tried it out? One should never believe that.”

“…… Why not?”

“It’s because the Gods are capricious.” [Tl note: fickle minded]

They are the spiritual beings who have just too much time on their hands to play with other ──

There is no way that the gods, whose thoughts cannot be measured or even understood by humans, would play the same game in a disciplined manner every single time.

The Giant God, Titan’s unprecedented game, “God Pretend” is a good example for this.

“What are the rules followed, what are the conditions for victory? It is due to this, it’s called the game of wits, doesn’t it? The only way to find that out is to examine each one of them, one by one by yourself. First of all, trusting the data for the god game of a god, who is yet to be defeated even once. Who is to certify that the data present there is completely true.

 

 “…………”

“That’s why we need proof. For example, even if it were me who got caught up in the current attack, I wouldn’t hold you all responsible for it in anyway.”

 

“tsu?”

Pearl gasps.

This was because she realized that the words spoken by Fei were not meant for her, but rather towards the apostles of the Blazing Flower standing behind.

“There can never be complete victory for man playing a game with God. Can it be a trap? And to know that there is no other way than to challenge it with complete determination. On top of that, the most important part is the promise “To never blame your friends for any mistakes that are made” ever.”

“…………!”

The members of the Blazing flower hang their head, frowning.

So that even they could comprehend what he understood, Fei made sure to raise their attention towards the tail of the God.

“Captain, you guys just before said this is to be a trap. A trap to deliberately make the human side attack it by colouring it in siler and making it stand out; and in response, counterattack in the process. That type of trap, right.”

“……That’s right.”

“I have a different opinion though.”

“Wha!?”

“I wonder if the Ouroboros will enjoy keeping such a trap. Just think about it. Would such an out-of-the-normal God be happy to just trap a few humans into its trap? They are not such petty creatures, these Gods that is.”

There has to be some meaning behind it.

Since, the God of Infinite, Ouroboros, made sure to only put a gimmick on this tail of it only.

Let’s Play using this~

It was as if it were trying to tell us that.

“It’s not a trap. Then what is it exactly?”

“It is a part that is to be legitimately used for conquering the game. Remember what the conditions of the game said once again.”

[Tl note: why did he believe in the apostle who grasped the title of the game?]

Game content “Forbidden Word”

【Win Condition】To have Ouroboros say “it hurts”

【Defeat Condition】 All participants drop out

【Hidden Rule 1】?？？？？

[Hidden Rule 2] When you achieve Rule 1, you can ■■■■■■ only for a certain time.

What I focused upon was this “Hidden Rule 1”.

“My idea is this. “Attack the tail of Ouroboros and counterattack”. This is not a trap. We are going in the right direction with the capture route as set down by that God.”

“IT’S NOT A JOKE!”

The one shouted was an apostle of the Blazing Flower, with a deep cut on his hand.

“Look at my wounds here, also, can you still talk after witnessing those hundreds of light-energy flashes!? If we had made a single mistake, we all would have been wiped out!”

“Although only four were.”

“……What?”

“I’m feel really sorry for the four people who were eliminated. But I think it would be rather illogical that no more casualties were there if Ouroboros really did aim and shot at us.”

It was definitely not a trap.

Chapter 4.10

 

Translated by: Darkapta
 Edited by: Hinagiku

 

 

The power of the rays is indeed off the charts, but the aim of them was clearly and cleverly made to miss their target as humans.

…… It would be really suspicious if these several hundreds of light rays that got put off, all missed to harm humans.

…… The capture step number one is as clear as day.

“Thus, it made it look like a “trap”, and got only a few people who were allowed to hit, directly. Although the apostle who got drawn as “chosen ones” got their luck really bad.”

“Are you really right in your mind……?”

The apostle girl had dumbfounded eye expressions.

The other members also had a similar atmosphere surrounding them.

“Are you seriously thinking that this is the capture route set by God? Or Are you perhaps saying something appropriate to protect that Pearl over there.”

“I am saying this very seriously.”

“── Then Fei.”

With a bitter face, the captain of “Light of Flame Blossom” opened his mouth.

“Even if attacking the tail of the God is a legitimate capture procedure, what are you planning to do from here out.”

“Of course, next is the consideration of the hidden rule number 2.”

“If you have understood it that far already, then, you do have an idea on what to do next too I guess?”

“nope, not at all”

“Wha!? How can you be so leisurely when you have no idea what to do next………….!!!!!!!!!”

“It’s okay to be leisurely. This doesn’t even seem to be a game with a time limit. Also, as far as we see it, till we don’t attack that tail, there doesn’t seem to be any counterattack light-rays coming in response even.”

Responding with no seriousness in his voice, Fei sat down on the back of God.
